Reviews.Review: Delicious food. Great views. Cute outdoor igloos - heated! Definitely recommend!
Great way to spend Christmas! Thank you to our server and food runners !!!

Magnífico trato, un lugar delicado y una cocina fantástica.
Muy recomendable
Drinks and food portions were smaller than last years’s. Not many vegetarian options. Food was ok, drinks also declined in quality
We visit this restaurant for our anniversary on December 19 every year, the service is great, the Iglo is private and cozy, the food section is small and expensive nevertheless the ambience is great
If you’re looking for a great dining spot, try Industry Kitchen! Their lobster tacos were delicious, and the service was outstanding—attentive and friendly. Recommend!
We were the only ones in the place, a little concerning but were later told we beat the high rush times. So we got spoiled by our waiter. Great service great food and great atmosphere.
Good food,  ver attentive service, great view of the East River and Brooklyn Heights.
We had a great sever and took care of us.  Great pizza and we enjoyed the night in the heated glass house
One of my FAVORITE restaurants! Been many times. Always a pleasure!

My sister and I are having a Girl's Weekend and we came here for brunch. We reserved an igloo and it was so adorable, heated nicely, and such a nice space. The only thing I would comment negatively on was the music--so loud.

The host stand was amazing and Adam, our server, was fantastic. It'a a beautiful space with a great menu. We had a wonderful time.
Sit inside the restaurant there are too many rats in the outside.
Great food, great service. It takes a little long to get your food on  Friday night, but it's so worth it!

The Industry Kitchen, located in New York City, is a modern American restaurant known for its unique location, creative menu, and stunning waterfront views of the East River and Brooklyn Bridge.The menu features a creative twist on American classics with Mediterranean influences. Popular dishes include wood-fired pizzas, fresh seafood. Recommend the Thanksgiving Pizza. It was a perfect combination on savory and sweet. Love that they have Mocktails and Cocktails so you have selection. Recommend you all check it out won't be disappointed.

Fantastic lunch! Chef Jonathan Haffmans is amazing. His food is creative, beautiful, with amazing flavors. You must try the vegan pumpkin cheesecake - fantastic flavors and incredible texture - could not believe it was vegan!
A beautiful day for lunch at Industry Kitchen.  We tried the Prix Fixe menu.  Very good.  The Chicken Gnocchi was a little too lite on the chicken.
Very nice location, perfect service and delicious food !
Amazing food, cocktails and views. It’s been awhile since I’ve been but I’m happy the quality hasn’t changed.
Terrible service.  Not kidding friendly.  Nice view
Service was great and our waiter was super friendly. The food was delicious. I highly recommend the watermelon and feta salad. Would most definitely go back
Love the view (table outside by the water) and service was wonderful!!
Good food, music does not need to be so loud.  Recommended for future stops

I’ve been here several times in the past and it has become my go too for a nice meal, good pricing and great ambience.  The staff is friendly and courteous, excellent and quick service and great pricing for its location, directly on the water.  It’s a great place to hang out with friends and people watch.  I’ve never had a bad experience here. Don’t hesitate to book your reservation.

3ieme fois dans ce restaurant, ne pas prendre les plats brunch/petit déjeuner, la qualité n’est pas incroyable.

Les autres plats sont eux par contre très bon et mérite un 4/5 étoiles. Les cocktails sont également très bon.
Food was great especially dessert and drinks! Water was lovely

We sat on the patio for a light lunch while in the area. The river view and area was great for us. There are runners, business professionals, many just walking by to enjoy the area. The drinks and pizza were amazing. Our wait staff…SUPERB!
This was my 5th time dining here - the food is consistently delicious and fresh! Love the variety of dishes they offer and sizes, perfect for sharing. Our official go-to spot in the Seaport!
Our server was very attentive and welcoming. We’re def coming back.

Loved the food and drinks here especially purple cucumber drink (I forgot what it was called) and the artichoke pizza! Cool spot in a great setting by the water. Can’t wait to go back to try other pizzas and the frozé!

I had pizza and garlic knots which tasted like cardboard, lobster tacos with with stale tacos. Overall disappointed. The restaurant itself has a very cool vibe right by the water with gorgeous views but wouldn't return for the food.
Bellissimo panorama e ottimo cibo. Io ho preso il filetto che è davvero strepitoso ad un prezzo nemmeno tanto alto. Consiglio assolutamente!

We live in Rockaway and take the ferry to pier 11 .   A short walk to Industry Kitchen, which has be come our favorite place to eat in lower Manhattan.  The pizza is great and my go to small plate is the lamb Meatballs.    But everything we have eaten there has been great.  
   I also like that there no surcharge for using a credit card as so many places do now.   I hate that and feel that if you need the money raise your price.   Many places add the surcharge so the cover the card fee or get cash the they may or may not report.

We had a great experience at Industry Kitchen. The food was good (especially the small plates - we loved with bao buns and the poke tuna nachos) and the service was outstanding. The view was especially beautiful at night on the water!

Wonderful in every way a restaurant with outdoor dining could provide!
Creative, satisfying menu items & great value.
Service was respectful and courteous.
Clean dining in terms of eating areas & other accommodations.
Will definitely return!
excellent meal, delicious steak. dynamic and very pleasant service
Other than the rats outside of the establishment, it was fine

Overall, the experience riverside was amazing.  The service staff were excellent, checking on us regularly to ensure we were happy and gave us time to enjoy the outdoor dining.  The Lobster Tacos hit the spot and we enjoyed the Steamed Mussels and Teraki Salmon for dinner.
Be aware of rats running on the street by the water
Beautiful spot for lunch on a nice day. The view is everything!

Both the hostess and the waiter were very nice and accommodating.  Food was not good. 
Chicken was overcooked.    Lamb meatballs and sauce were too spicy, and it was difficult to eat without drinking many glasses of water.     Not worth it for what the meal costs.

I live in the city and love dining at Industry Kitchen! You cannot beat the location with beautiful views of the East River, Brooklyn etc. The staff is so welcoming and the service is always fantastic. Special shout out to Catherine, Nyla, Jonas and Salesta, who always make me feel like family whenever I dine here.

This time around, my friend and I both ordered the Fattoush Salad (mine w/salmon - cooked perfectly - raw the way I like it and my friend had shrimp added to her salad and she loved it). 

This restaurant is easily accessible by the East River ferry to the Wall Street/Pier 11 stop and is only a few steps away.

Highly recommend if you're in the area. I'll definitely be back!
Meatballs and kale salad was great but the hot honey pizza tasted like they just defrosted it from a grocery store freezer.

This was the first time my husband and I visited after many attempts (4). We had such a great time. Drinks were really good food was really good our favorite the truffle wedges fries! And our server Alexis was amazing! She provided us options and suggestions. We will definitely e visiting again! The manager on that night 8/24 was just awesome. Debbie
This is  “local” place for us. We ordered the meatball appetizer and is was obviously not fresh. Everything else was good. Be consistent. I’m in restaurant industry

We went during Christmas last year. The set up is completely different but the quality is unchanged. Good food, good service, good portions, good view…a tad pricey but we will definitely be back a third time! (My only small complaint is the bathroom doors don’t open out so you have to touch the handle. They should attach the foot piece that allows you to open the door with your foot)

Happily surprised food was great ! They held our reservation we were 30 mins late so accommodating and the server was sooooo great he was like the cherry on the top to make our meal enjoyable and fun.
Staff were friendly. Amazing food with drinks are great!

We had a lovely lunch at Industry Kitchen. The service and food were good. We sat inside with doors open to the outside with a view of the Hudson and Brooklyn. We ordered apps, pizza and Kale salad which came quickly. For some reason the acoustics are bad and you have to shout to talk even though the music didn’t seem to be too loud. Regardless I do recommend this restaurant.
Great experience, amanzing food, beautiful view on Brooklyn and great service!
Great food, variety of choices!  Highly recommend!
Food is pretty good. Service is subpar. Our server should leave serving and do something else.

We choose Indusrty for dinner before an event near by. Great choice! The service was friendly, helpful, attentive and prompt. Our waiter gave us recommendations and helped us decide what to order. We ordered 4 small plates for the 2 of us, and each one was wonderful! A lovely experience!

Service is always great, ambience is fantastic,  drinks were good, food is generally very good. surprisingly, this time, the margherita pizza was not very good. It was from the Restaurant week menu and it seemed it  may have been sitting in the back, did not taste fresh at all.
Salad was underwhelming. Amazing service though .
Food was good- nice venue on the water! Manager should have had a conversation with the couple making out the ENTIRE time we are. Very inappropriate- a family asked to be moved

Industry Kitchen has a great view and good choice menu. Take advantage of the restaurant week pre fixe menu, great value. The food is great and service is good. But beware, be prepared if dining as the sun sets the riverside rodents are out and about.
Great atmosphere.  We went to outdoor show after.  I highly recommend this place.  I bit pricy, but then again what's not expensive now a days?
We ordered an eclectic mix of appetizers and mains. Everything was very good. Our server was good, but a little over extended. I would definitely go back.
Had a business lunch with a client who loves the restaurant. All the food was delicious except the gnocchi with chicken. Service was excellent and I would recommend Industry for future meals.

Overall a great meal , the restaurant was very noisy , so if you are looking for quiet conversation , this is not the spot .

The restaurant week menu was very good , the only callout is the crème brûlée was very ,very thin .
It’s always a great experience at Industry Kitchen, aside from the great view, food , the service is always exceptional.
Work dinner.  Everything was delicious.  Server was great.
Great restaurant week specials! Great cocktails and service would highly recommend.

1st time for the three of us at I dusted Kitchen and we enjoyed it very much. Sat inside due to the heat and humidity, and it was very noisy. Food was terrific, server was very good; the only issue was the food came out from the kitchen at different time for all of us. Not a huge deal, more of an irritation. Lobster Ravioli was excellent!

We loved Industry Kitchen. It's location on the waterfront is incredible and it was very busy so others must love it too. Despite how busy it was, our server was excellent and took great care of us. We had the lamp pops and the beef bao and they are both so delicious. We will definitely be back.

I a faithful customer of this place and I’m never disappointed.  Food and drinks and the view are always exceptional and I strongly recommend it.  But - I always find  the service suboptimal: the feeling is that they are kind of annoyed when they sit me and then overwhelming when I’m at the table. This last time the server came to ask how was everything once every five minutes for the entire meal… way too invasive.
But I will go back
Such a good spot to go to during the summer. Incredible food, service, and view.
Riley one of the hosts, and our fabulous server, Patrick made my daughter’s 21st Birthday dinner so special!  Huge shout outs to them!!  Thank you. ❤️

I really like the place and they have good food/service and the location is pretty amazing with great sunset views. The only problem is rats. We dined on the patio right in front of the entrance and witnessed the rats roam freely and chase each other accross the walkway!! It was so bad it became comical at some point. The restaurant staff seemed to be used to it and barely did anything. I completely understand that NYC has a rat issue but I never witnessed anything even close to seeing so many in the open while dining.

The food here was great! The views are amazing.  Service was cool too. Here is the catch.... For a restaurant that has a $2,000 pizza the indoor portion of things was a little bit left to be desired. We were seated by I guess a large item that may be outdoors sometimes that is covered by clothes. There are FLIES alot of FLIES one literally died mid air during our meal and landed on the table. 

I want to say again the SERVICE is great! The manager with the blonde hair came by and checked in, the people are friendly … Drinks were on point too.  Just be aware that there are flies and the inside doesn't give $2,000 pizza vibes.  If you sit outside everything will be fine.
We had the nicest server, the food was good and the location is beautiful.
One of our favorite spots in nyc. Great food and wonderful views
We loved our waiter. He knew we were celebrating a birthday and made sure our experience was amazing.
Another grand experience with the first try of spicy mussels

Went on a Sunday. Ryan, the server was excellent. He had eaten the menu and was able to make great recommendations. In a hot evening, great food, drinks and a super fun waiter is a great combo. Highly recommend this place. 5stars!
Great location along the water with views of the Brooklyn bridge. Service is courteous and efficient. Food is delicious and fresh. Highly recommend for a nice evening with good drinks and light fare.
Great experience definitely recommend to others as the food was delish!
Waffles were very hard, I asked the waitress if that's how they are supposed to be prepared, and she replied yes. Idk....
Great experience, excellent food. The host Solestra was very attentive from start to finish.
Ambiance, food, cocktails and service were all top-notch!
Everything was great food service and atmosphere. Only thing is the music is always just a little too loud even outside. ￼￼
Our server Ryan was friendly and energetic! We were not rushed and the food was good. Overall it was a positive experience.
Service was excellent food was just ok but for location I feel it was reasonably priced.
The space was really nice at this time of the year (summer time). The food was spectacular and the drinks were mixed very well.
Great summertime fun   Great drinks and good food at out door setting
Frozen drinks are amazing! Had lamb lollipops and lobster tacos. Yummy

Food was fresh but the poke bowl was disappointing I wish the server disclosed how small it was and that it has no base really. The pizza was great but the prosciutto needed to be smaller because biting was very messy. Service was good!!
An easy go to when bringing guests from out of town… great vibe, nice views, good service and good food..

The food was low quality for the price, there was a hair in my friends dish. The server was not regularly available, I had to ask multiple times for a new appetizer plate as mine had a bug
On it. The view of the pier was hindered because of how loud and crowded it was. There was a photographer taking pictures of other tables that bumped into me without an apology and the experience was extremely negative overall. I would not recommend this to anyone.
Awesome service definitely will return. Everything was wonderful!

This is not a good place for serious business meals. The waitress was too pushy and hovered over to see the tip amount and showed visible dismay at the 15% tip on the credit card. She asked my guess if they thought the service was good to pressure me into a larger tip. The funny thing about this is that I always intended to give her 20% but I can’t put 20% on the company card so I leave additional money to cover the 20% tip (which I did). Just not an appropriate place to have serious client meetings or even basic busines lunches.
We were celebrating my Goddaughter graduating from HS. Everything was wonderful from the food to the drinks to the service.
We had a wonderful evening and were still able to eat outside when it started raining because the staff opened up the outside umbrellas. Such a fun experience.

ALL restrooms here are GENDER COMBINED!!!! There is ZERO option for PRIVACY! Men & women share MULTI-STALL bathrooms. I have a 16 year old daughter and did not allow her to go to the bathroom here. I did NOT FEEL COMFORTABLE and neither did my young daughter. Even the man entering after me said WTF! I am disgusted and will NEVER return to this restaurant. I’m NOT homophobic so don’t you dare go there. As a parent, my daughter deserves to feel safe. Forcing an agenda will ruin this business. End of story.
Not bad at all. A bit loud inside and the service was a bit slow (Granted it was busy). Worth it for the location.
Good and tasty food. Very friendly staff. Nice view. Both indoor and outdoor options.
Great service, location and food. The only thing; nyc rats outside but not sure what the restaurant can do about it

We loved it!   The food is excellent and they couldn’t have done more to accommodate us!

I will return!
Great service and the food was great.  Nice place to have dinner

We were a party of six who went there on Father’s Day. Food was ok and ambiance sitting outside was the best. Service on the other hand was poor. Order came out slowly, tea came at the end of the meal. But the worst was that our waiter came to our table at the end asking for payment and refused to show us the bill until we paid. We had to pay first in order to check our bill for mistakes. We found this unreasonable and very unprofessional.
Awesome food & atmosphere - our server was definitely amazing.
Superb in every way - as ever.  A great team that made sure of excellence from greeting to departure. Very well done without being solicitous. A great atmosphere for a fun time with delicious food

food arrived cold and undercooked.  the beef short rib eggs benedict included almost no meat at all, (little shred of rib here and there).  while the server could not have been nicer, this is a one-and-done visit.

The pizza that two of us had was delicious as always. But I was excited to try the vegan omelette and happy to see a new plant-based choice on the menu. Ugh, I should have stuck with pizza. Unfortunately it was absolutely inedible and the manager of such a big and popular restaurant should be embarrassed to serve such unappetizing slop to valued customers. It was powdery, watery yellow slop with about a tablespoon of vegetables inside. I picked out the filling, ate the salad and shared my son’s pizza. I should have said something but I didn’t. I feel bad that I wasted over $20 for that crap, and left hungry. 

That “omelette” should be taken off the menu until the chef actually figures out how to prepare a vegan omelette. May I suggest a tofu scramble or chickpea flour omelette instead? There are a lot of good recipes out there for them. And actually make sure it’s edible before insulting good-paying customers with slop.
Great vibe, great view, really good food. It's going to be loud, but it's worth it.

We were a group of coworkers/friends getting together for a little reunion and celebration of a retirement.  That staff made sure things were going well several times.  Our server Sam was on top of things.  The food was tasty. There was even a celebratory dessert given to our retiree.
If I had anything to complain about it would be that my food wasn't hot when I received it. I had the meatballs and potato wedges and they were both luke warm.  I didn't complain because they all tasted good,  but I would have preferred them to be a little warmer. Otherwise,  we had a very enjoyable experience.
The food and drinks were good, location is great. Lots of seating outside. The staff were kind and helpful.
Great food! Perfect location. Little issues with service (payment). Server indicated before we ordered she would do separate checks then when came time to pay she the she couldn’t do it.
Food and Service were very good ! Would definitely go back again !
Everything was delicious! Even the spinach gnocchi
The gluten free/dairy free pizza was outstanding with delicious toppings, warm, and crispy--much better than last time, when it was cold and skimpy on the toppings. Nice server.
Server was never around, had to hunt her down.  Menu is little different now  but pizza is always good.

Across the street and convient. It was a rainy quiet memorial  day visit so restaurant was very quiet. Food and menu was approachable and good. Great location on the waterfront. Lots of outdoor seating which would be gear in a nice day and better weather. Still, it was just what we need on a travel day. Simple, good food and nice atmosphere.

We had a lovely dinner! Location is on the water with beautiful views in a lively area. Casual vibe with great music playing.

Food was yummy we had the lamb lollipops, brussel sprouts and lobster ravioli - ate every bite! Cocktails were made perfect! We will be back for sure!

The food was very good and the people working there did a great job.  We had a delicious half bottle of excellent French Wine and the price was reasonable.  We shared an Ahi Tuna Nachos and also shared Pan Roasted Chicken.  They were large enough to share for two women and that's what we did.  The environment was excellent.  We loved sitting outside.
Great - needs more vegan options for brunch! Fabulous servers!!
Lovely dining experience filled with joyful people. I would highly recommend!
One of our favorite nyc restaurants but it’s so loud that we can’t have a conversation.
Tout était très bien c’est juste dommage de boire un bon verre de vin dans un verre en plastique 😉

Staff was hospitable and the environment was nice. Disappointed in the quality of the food.
I ordered a Fatoosh salad with salmon. The salmon didn’t taste fresh and didn’t look grilled (no grill Mary) It was dry and tasteless. There was no mint or parsley that I could detect. The lamb meatballs were tiny and dry. The Caesar salad was average. The best item was the potato wedge appetizer.

Noisy -music too loud
View -wonderful view of the east river near the seaport
Food - just okay

Food was delicious and service was really good.
I will come back!
Great location and views. Friendly service. Food was ordinary . Convenient place to eat  near ferries. Would go back if down in that  area.
We will be back!  It was our second time we love it!! The Honey Bee Pizza is delicious!
Food ok, tables too close to one another very very loud could not hear each other talk though, nice view though
We loved our date night at Industry Kitchen! It was our first night in New York and we were so glad we spent it here. Brooke was our server and she was awesome!

Great spot for a pre Pier 17 event.  The menu has a ton of options that should appeal to most preferences.  Staff was super friendly and attentive.  Near waterfront dining is enjoyable for the views of Brooklyn and people watching.
Great food and excellent service. The noise level was high (but in an fairness we were seated next to two large groups). Can’t wait to go back when the patio is open; they have an excellent view.

Loved the food!   Mussels were plentiful in a pot with a lid to keep them warm as you eat!  The broth was amazing!  Lobster tacos were delicious!   The bao buns-yum!!   What a great find!    Soooo good!  Can’t wait to go back!

We have been to Industry Kitchen many times and we like the food and location. But there were a few things that annoyed me last night. I made a simple request to make my pizza half margarita and half another kind on the menu. Every pizza place I’ve been to is able to do this, but the chef refused. “We can’t do that” they said. Why not if that’s what the customer wants? So I had to change my request and ask for ricotta cheese as a topping on my margarita. I got about a teaspoon of ricotta per slice, so skimpy, and was charged extra for that. 

In terms of comfort, it got very chilly when the sun went down, and there were no heat lamps. I was so cold I couldn’t wait to get the check and leave. 

I understand this place is more expensive because of the ambiance of sitting near the water and it is NYC, but all my son and I ordered were two personal pizzas, and a glass of mocktail punch for him (I drank water), and the bill was $77. A bit outrageous, especially since I was uncomfortably cold and couldn’t get what I wanted. 

We go occasionally because it’s a great view of the harbor and the food tastes good, but there is definitely room for improvement. The chef needs to be less rigid and stingy, and they should invest in some heat lamps to make customers more comfortable while enjoying the view, or at least leave their igloos up until the end of May.
It was ok. Food was just fine. Very pricey. A bit of a tourist trap for sure given location. Limited menu. No burgers or wings. Service super friendly.
Ordered a bottle a wine… no real cups… served in plastic cup…
Delicious food, our server (David) was so kind, and the staff were accommodating for our wheelchair.
Great service , the chicken francese was elite. Thank you
Great food, service, the views of the Brooklyn Bridge are awesome...great people watching too if you're outside.

This was a last minute reservation we booked maybe 2 hours before going. One of us had gone already but it was first time for the rest of us. They accommodated us even though we were late to our original reservation so we were happy about that. The igloos are such good vibe if you’re with friends, yes they will be going towards the warmer weather but for now if you can get one they are great. Ryan our server was excellent !!! He was so incredibly patient explaining everything to us and reassured me about a dish I wasn’t sure if I was going to like but I ended up loving it. He was also super friendly and funny and checked in on us without being too much at the table.
The food was also excellent, everything presentation, taste was worth the money. We loved everything we had and the dessert tower was a great ending for any reservations that are a large group or multiple people.
Definitely will be back for sure ! If you go ask for Ryan !!
Wonderful hosts greetings. Ate outside along the river. Healthy Pott and good service.

My cousin and I had dinner here last night and our experience was fantastic from start to finish. We sat outside in one of the cute huts (heated and so comfortable) with a beautiful view of the Hudson River. 

We ordered the grilled Atlantic salmon and the fattoush salad with salmon. My cousin and I ended up swapping our meals in the middle and suffice it to say, we both thoroughly enjoyed both entrees. My salmon was cooked to perfection (I like it rare). 

I also ordered a Downeast Cider which was delish!

I was greeted by Ishaeb when I arrived who was so chill and welcoming. Ditto re: Salesta too. Our server Merlin was outstanding - attentive, efficient and friendly.
Kudos to the hiring manager!

I highly recommend Industry Kitchen. The food was delicious, the ambiance was perfect and the service was fantastic. The staff really epitomize what exemplary customer service is all about!
Best best best Butternut Squash soup I’ve ever had. Beautiful view of the water. And extraordinary crème brûlée.
I’ve been here 2 times. Both times the staff & the food were excellent!

Great destination for a work lunch that also served as a celebration for a departing colleague. 
Attentive service; great food. Even though we arrived early they were able to eat us nearly immediately.
Service at the bar high top tables was slow. Food was ok
Very good vibes, big open space and excellent service. We had the pizza and it was okay but our friends had other food items and really liked them!
Good location. The food was ok. It wasn’t hot though. Everything felt warmed up not freshly cooked

While my dinner would not be a big check, more attentive service would have been nice. I drink a lot of ice tea when I go to dine out. Straw was too short for the glass it was served in and I was charged for a refill.
Staff were very pleasant. It can be loud later in the evening, but I went early enough that the noise level was low.
The gnocchi was delicious!
Their truffle fries and lobster tacos are to die for! 10/10
Overall an ok dining experience. Not mediocre but not pleasant either.

We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly with the igloo dining experience!!!  After sharing a pizza, tuna nachos, shishito peppers, and a trio of marvelous dips, my group of 3 were extremely satisfied.  Many thanks to I.K !!!
Nice dinner in a tiny and cosy igloo house. Good service.
good place, nicer in warm weather, but pretty good even in the winter.

We went for restaurant week and all the food was amazing and a great value. We sat in one of the igloos and loved it, it’s private and great for a date night and the water views were beautiful! Our waiter Eddy was also wonderful :)
wonderful as always. i left my pictures on the table but besides that it was a great time
Great experience Raley the waiter was cool & very professional

As it was a stormy Tuesday night the restaurant was relatively empty when I got there but also the waitstaff numbers had been impacted by the weather.  Wouldn't have known it at all...everyone was welcoming and warm...after a very long day of travel was thrilled to tuck into some non-airport food that was delivered quickly and was delicous...the wine helped too.

Always a great spot for after work bites and drinks. 
Been coming for years and always have a great time.
Great location with river views, service was great couldn’t do enough for us. Food was fresh and tasted fantastic.

Loved our NYE igloo experience!
Food and service couldn’t have been better.
Just very good but at a restaurant like that I would expect glass made of glass and not plastic. Food was very delicious. Service was good
What a great spot for NYE. Amazing food, service, and ambiance.
Ate in one of the Igloos, very comfy. Nice & Warm, great service, efficient & friendly.
View is nice, needs more attention if food. Bland.

Fantastic food, quick and excellent service!!!
Host was very accommodating and our server was so prompt and efficient

The outdoor seating in the igloos was absolutely wonderful and so was our service. Our server was attentive and the service was speedy. We had the lamb lollipops and the tuna nachos. Both were okay. It’s a great place for a drink and appetizer with a view.

We had the best experience. Our table took a bit longer than anticipated and they took such good care of us. It was such a fun place, our food was awesome, and everyone was incredibly kind and professional. 1000% will go back next time we are in town!
Fantastic experience.  Good food, good drinks and a nice location. Also the service is brilliant. We enjoy our dinner
I've been going to Industry Kitchen for years. It's now my go to place for Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners when my family is out of town. Great place to bring dates for a drink at sunset.

Really nice quick eat spot, we sat in igloos outside and it was a lovely experience. The food is nice, not something I’d say you absolutely need to eat there but still good food. Price is reasonable also. The staff were really nice and helpful

Better food than I thought. 
Good prices
Great service 
Igloos are cool
Dinner in the igloos was so fun and a special atmosphere! The pizza was good as well as the lobster tacos and Buratto’s salad especially. Service was very attentive.

Great food and the dishes came out fast. We dined in the igloo and the servers were very attentive.  The only con was the igloo was super warm, but once we opened the door it was cooler.  The igloos were so festive and fun, I didn't mind the heat.  Also, if it was colder outside then it may not have seemes so warm.
I would definitely make another trip to try different food options and maybe try the igloo at night.
Great food, service, atmosphere, view, and location!!!
Veronica was a very nice and pleasant waitress. Dinner was the best we've ever had. Compliments to the chef.

The view was beautiful from the outdoor dining, however, keep in mind that the space in the igloo is very small. We were 2 adults and 2 children with jackets and handbags, there was not much room but we enjoyed the experience. The waitstaff was pleasant. We ordered a pizza to share for appetizer which we all enjoyed. Some of the hot food came out cold so we had to send it back, the waitstaff was very apologetic and it then came out better temp. Overall it was good and location was perfect as we were going to Pier 17.

The food was delicious and the service was amazing.  Our food came out fast and didn't disappoint! Everything was tasty! We booked a holiday igloo for our reservation at Industry Kitchen, we enjoy the beautiful view and the private dining experience.

Had a nice time here sitting outside in the igloos. Nice to be able to control the heater as well. With the igloos it is a little tight so it is something to know.  but it is nice to have an intimate date (as it was for my experience). Food was really delicious. We also picked a delicious vegan dish. Great to have that option.
We were greeted warmly, our server was outgoing and friendly, and the food delicious.

I love  Industry Kitchen!  After walking past a few times, I finally got to dine at Industry Kitchen with my family.  Our teens sat in a private glasshouse igloo, and the adults sat inside.  The decor is lovely and festive with some nice photo spots,  and the menu was very nice for brunch.  We had everything from salalds, to eggs, to waffles & pancakes & pizza and there were no complaints-just empty plates.  Our server was on point, and  everything was easy.  Highly recommend others to visit and I can't wait to return!

Great service very accommodating staff.
Food was amazing and drinks spectacular
We had dinner in one of the igloo houses the restaurant put up for the holidays. Really good atmosphere

It is very rare that I write a review as my family is heavily involved in the metro area restaurant business and I understand all of the challenges that restaurants are faced with  however this experience left me feeling remorse for the $200 spent that I would have preferred to donate.  We were told four things that we tried to order were out of stock and then spied someone at a nearby table who arrived after us eating one of them.  We would have indulged in 3-4 cocktails each but my husband canceled his second drink after 40 minutes and not being able to attract any attention.  The main course was piled on top of the appetizer plates.  We could not track anyone down to provide more water.  The lemondate my girls ordered was all ice.  I could go on for hours.  If the garage we parked in had been open later I would have hunted down a manager but given that we were trying to have a festive day downtown (we live on the UES) and the insane disappointment and disgust with our meals and service, the only thing I wanted to do was leave.  I will not apologize for this being harsh.  We eat out 4 nights a week ranging from Michelin star to local establishments, and this was just a regret.
Locale molto caratteristico con tavoli esterni incastonate in piccole serre per gustare un panorama incredibile.
They really need to add at least 1 more lamb chop to the Lamb Lollipos serving.. It was very good, but  a very light serving

We really enjoyed our outdoor dining in the little houses by the water. It was a cool rainy day and the space heaters were perfect. The food was wonderful.  Meals are huge, but delicious.  We really enjoyed our brunch. Our server was attentive as well.
I love this place!!! Both summer and winter, they have amazing atmosphere.
We have a reservation for one of the green houses and it was a wonderful experience. Service was awesome and food was delicious. I would definitely recommend and go back again.
Our server Stefan was great very attentive.  Loved the little igloos a great experience overall!
Great great service. Fast. Delicious. Very worthwhile for families.  Igloo seating was fun.
Excellent service and meal. Had my birthday party for a big group and they were very accommodating despite my having extra surprise guests. Truly outstanding chef in Jonathan Haffmans as well.
Great view but the food is just average. Prices are a little high.

Visited Industry Kitchen on 11/23/23 for Thanksgiving dinner. Reservation was at 7pm and we had all traveled from Los Angeles in hopes of being near the water and having a great dinner. Unfortunately, when we arrived we were sat down and then told that there was no longer any Thanksgiving dinner options or plates. We were told that there was a limit of 250 plates, which was never stated in their website or flyers that were posted online and in person. The waiter told us they ran out of everything, including turkey and mashed potatoes. We were inclined to order from the regular menu. Some individuals in our group ordered steak with a baked potato. The waiter returned 5 minutes later and told 2 individuals that they had ran out of baked potatoes and given the option of substituting with french fries (truffle fries). This was very disappointing. I gave the waiter the idea of adding mashed potatoes to the dish instead of french fries with the steak, which they were finally able to do. Overall very disappointing and overcharged for the small portions of food.
I love the igloo but the main reason I was there was to have a Thanksgiving special platter which was not available for my early 6PM dinner.

Enjoyed Thanksgiving day dinner at Industry Kitchen. They served their regular menu with an option for a traditional turkey dinner. Great view of the Brooklyn Bridge. All good!  My only complaint is that all drink glasses were plastic which does detract from the cocktail experience.
A true jewel in the neighborhood! From start to finish, Industry Kitchen is a wonderful dining experience.

We were a group of 9 friends who traveled from the Bronx by NYC Ferry to IK. We had heard great things about IK and our visit did not disappoint.
The variety of food was great, we all trued something new.
We return in the Spring!
We had such a wonderful time here. The ambience was great, the food was incredible, and was just a great place to have a good time.

I proposed to my Fiance just before this dinner reservation. Everyone on staff that we came in contact with made it a point to congratulate us and make us felt special. We were checked on many times to ensure we were good, but also given tons of privacy as we were celebrating such a special day. We are so appreciative of the great service and will highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting NYC. thank you all!
Always love coming here very nice ambiance, excellent service.

Ordered the halibut medium/rare and it was totally welldone/overcooked! This happened for the second time. Food overall is excellent but the fish was not satisfying. Unfortunately they did not offer an exchange for this which was sad. Wouldn’t order this dish again.
Great food - nice portions, love the outdoor igloos
Food was good- I had a Cobb salad with shrimp.  The iced tea did not taste fresh however.  Our server was really nice and accommodating.
The found was fresh, flavorful and the meat was cooked perfectly.  The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The little igloo/tents also made for a more intimate experience.
So fun sitting in the igloo!  They took great care of our dog and the view was fantastic!

Took my husband here for his birthday and I can’t recommend it enough. Of course the atmosphere is beautiful, with the enclosed clear outdoor table and incredible waterside view, but the service was what made it amazing. I made the reservation on OpenTable and just clicked the birthday special occasion, but didn’t add any notes or special requests. Upon arriving the hotesses greeted my husband with Happy Birthday and they gave us an incredible table of our choice. Our server, Eddie was so attentive and intentional and always checked to make sure we had everything we needed. The manager even stopped by to check on us too! We will absolutely be back and will be telling all of our friends about this gem!
Good food and service. We liked this place very much.
Great service and our lunches were amazingly fresh and flavorful.
We had a blast and our guest from Florida enjoy the meal.  The service was great.  We enjoy eating in the glass little houses.
Had a great lunch with a large crowd!  Service was terrific.  Server went out of his way to make us comfortable & was never rushed even as the restaurant got crowded.
We had a great time, enjoying delicious food and whine outside on the sunny terrace! It made our first day in NYC u forgettable.
We had a wonderful dinner!  The service was great and food was excellent!  Thank you!

Nice outdoor seating with great views of the East River. Very friendly and attentive staff. The poke bowl served in a coconut shell is a must. Medium portions, not too small and not more food than you can eat. Upscale crowd but laid back. Great venue for small teams of colleagues.
The staff bent over backwards to accommodate our party of 8.  Excellent service, great food and fun ambience.

Great food and great service
Looking forward to going back
We went after a wedding brunch and had a few margaritas and pizzas.  The staff was wonderful and the views are great. Not terribly expensive for lower manhattan water views.
food was ok but not great. Bao buns were a little hard, broccoli dish was a total miss, somewhat unenthusiastic service. Interesting waterfront location, under the bridge.
Great location. Wonderful food. Great way to see south street port.
Noisy atmosphere, and smell of exhaust from the boats and cars. Food was alright.

This is my second time here.  The food is amazing.  The manager is really lovely and engaged.  She walks and checks in on tables in a very casual and welcoming manner.  Our server the first time was a really friendly young man that made great recommendations especially since I’m not a sweet cocktail drinker.  This time our server was a young woman that clearly needed a nap.  She was very matter of fact, seemed bothered and just overall lack luster.  Everyone is entitled to a bad day so it won’t deter me from returning to this great gem on the water.
Was an excellent day for outdoor dining. The staff were very courteous and food excellent. We will return again.
Christian was awesome & the artichoke and mushroom pizza was amazing!!

Location is great - we had a beautiful day to be sitting by the river.  Service very helpful; Ryan was great.  We used to love the tuna nachos but the recipe seems to have changed - much less tuna. Would not order these again.

Cool place! We went on a rainy day for lunch and were pleasantly surprised with our experience. The food was great and service was friendly. The burrata and prosciutto pizza tasted better than it looked and also enjoyed the meatballs, bao buns and gnocchi.
A great place for an Al fresco dining experience. The service is friendly and responsive, the prices are fair and the view is spectacular especially as the Seaport and Brooklyn light up after sunset.
Great place. Amazing view and great service. Food is ok 👌.
Food is good and the service is great.  A little pricey, but it's also NYC.
The good was delicious! My favorite was the lamb lollipop!
We received stale bread and meh food. Expensive. Nice to be on the water.
First time in NY,  perfect Spot,  amazing view,  great food and service. Ate there twice

The waiter was great very polite and accommodating.
The location was perfect and beautiful scenery.￼
The food was good the drinks were not don’t order mojitos they don’t know how to make them! But aside from that I would definitely recommend and go back.

The person who showed us our seat was rude. The waiters came late to ask at least for water and drinks. The food was average for the price I was paying. The only thing that was nice was the view from the outside seating.

Industry Kitchen was recommended by Venetta at Hilton DoubleTree on Stone Street in the financial district. Their front desk personnel double as concierges. I hope they get double the pay!

We had a wonderful view of the pier! The food was absolutely delicious! Being from the South, we thought everything in NY restaurants was overpriced. We had the delicious Northern Italian soup, the grilled salmon with the vegetables, and the burrata was delish! Our server was a little confused or overwhelmed- not sure, but he was not efficient. A female server came to our rescue, apologized and took our order. She had a great attitude and cheerful disposition. If we're back in NY again, this  will be a deliciously reliable place.
Worthwhile for the setting and view, not so much for the food. Had to send mine back (which I rarely do) because it was lukewarm at best.
good quick service. nice drinks.  good value for a good meal.

Great views. Mediocre food. Our food was on our table within less than 10 minutes of ordering which is great if you’re in a hurry but not so great for the quality. Everything was prepped ahead of time and it was obvious in the flavor.

I had a black coffee and these was a very bad.
I asked the staff of it tea was but he said it was coffee. Also the ceasar salar tasted different as last time😔😔
Food and drinks were amazing. Highly recommend the bao bao buns and pizza!
Seafood dishes were wonderful as always but the drinks, that aren’t cheap, were also not full.
Solid experience all around - food, service, ambiance, and great views. Perfect on a summer day, enjoyed the inside/outside dining.
Food and drink options were tasty. Great outdoor space. Helpful server.

Wonderful outdoor late lunch with kids who loved the pizza. We loved the salads . Service was great. 
It was loud even in quieter part of the restaurant but certainly ok. But it wasn’t prime time.

My husband (his first time) and I came in from Rockaway in the ferry for an early dinner.   
We couldn’t decide which appetizer to get so we got only appetizers.  We started with burrata and lamb lollipop and then we had the meatballs and a pizza.  
Everything was delicious and our server Veronica was very attentive.

Con Ed and EPA were right by our table --the smell from the sewer and noise was unbearable --they quickly accommodated us.  Service was outstanding --again noise level even though we moved was loud --not their fault.

I booked this spot for a business meal on a whim. I just saw it while I was out walking and thought it looked like a place I would enjoy. It did not disappoint. We had several small plates, pizza and lobster ravioli plus the panna cotta and tiramisu cones. Everything was delicious and the service was top notch. The view was amazing as well. Highly recommend this restaurant!

We enjoyed the food.  It was the second time that I had gone.  I ordered the pizza and was awesome, we shared the lamb chops with my daughter which she always enjoys.  And my wife ordered a Cesar salad that was good to her taste.
Really great service and very nice atmosphere! We enjoyed our dinner!

Excellent place to go with a large group on a beautiful day. Solid service and a very fun ambience. Would highly recommend the appetizers and the strong drinks. A little overpriced, but you pay for the ambience.
Food is good, great service, our server is so pleasant, ambiance... awesome view overlooking the water! Good vibe overall!
Loved this restaurant and can’t wait to go back! It was absolutely delicious.

The food was absolutely amazing. I’m a pizza girl, so a good pizza goes a long way. I had the pepperoni pizza, and my boyfriend had a margarita pizza. I recommend that 10/10. It was a group of us and the lobster tacos. Also, I must say was delicious, and refreshing. Can’t wait to come back here although the service we were close to closing time, so I completely understood why we had to hurry up and order. Thank you so much for accommodating me and my friends and family, again can’t wait to come back here. ￼

Very good experience
Atmosphere and quite good vine but too much expensive
Unhappy with our service. Got charged when we asked for extra pita bread which was not told to us, had to ask repeatedly for water, and for our check.

Everytihg was great the space, the food, the service and  the view 
Had lot's of good menue choices 
the Fatoush Salad eith Buratta was incredible as was the large cut fries the omelette and Huevos Rancheros

I had brunch on Saturday with a friend from out of town - both of us were pleased with the setting of the restaurant.  It was a lovely sunny day so the setting by the water was perfect. The food was delicious, service was average, and the vibe was great. I’ll certainly be back.  Thank you!
Great food, loved the variety, and service was top notch. Highly recommend, but make sure to make a reservation!
Food was delicious and the ambiance was great!! I will be back

We ordered many items from the menu. Everything was well done and delicious! The service was excellent and the food came to our table within minutes of ordering. The view of the river made the experience even more memorable
Food is amazing for so many years at this place! Best view of the bridge too!
We loved everything about it and the location is perfection!

Loved it. Beautiful place. Turn down the music until later in the evening. You don’t need “club music” decibel levels at 7:00 pm.  Your location on the water should be your background “music” until later. 
Great place!!
Lunch during restaurant week.  View, food, service exceptional.
Location is great! Food was good. Service was good.
Lovely ambiance. Our server was absent the entire dining experience and it was difficult to flag him down (it wasn't overly busy).

Arrived with reservations for Sunday brunch at 12:00.  Were seated at table next to the service counter instead of away from it. We were the second party entering the restaurant so plenty of tables available. However, the new waiter got confused when we requested a different table so we didn't push it.    The lemonade was undrinkable; tasted more like the mix used for whiskey sours.  Did not drink.  Our waiter was unavailable
so we didn't request it be taken off the bill.  The Hunter omelet was perfect and delicious.  Service, however, was extremely rushed-constantly coming by to remove a plate, even while one person was still eating.  
Will give Industry Kitchen a second try.
Industry Kitchen was a pure delight.  Lunch was lovely, light, and charming!

We reserved tables to celebrate birthday which was a special occasion. I usually enjoy the experience at this location but not this time. It started off good but our server was rude and had a nasty attitude.

I was the host for this lunch meeting with a client.  It was a large group which I booked ahead of time.  I was charged ahead of time which isn't a problem but for a lunch meeting the dollar amount of $80 per person is excessive.  I don't mind paying for what we order but people weren't drinking and to spend $80 for a meal is too high.  I feel $50 would be sufficient and still on the high side.  There was over $200 that I paid that was for nothing.  People took food to go and we ordered apps and meals and still didn't meet the required amount.  Our server was excellent. 
I will not book a large group there again.  
Thank you.

The only positive feature of this restaurant is its location on a peer with (partial) view on Brooklyn bridge. The service was poor, just like the courses served. Tiny portions for disproportionately high prices. Not recommended.
Me and my friends went there and the atmosphere,energy,and the food was amazing
Nice spot to eat outside at the Seaport. Pizza was good, really enjoyed the watermelon and feta salad. Place was really busy on a Saturday night but server was attentive.
Industry Kitchen has a good food and drinks along with a location on the water that is hard to beat.
Great food, great variety, great service, great atmosphere, all at a very favorable price.
We went with friends. Good experience but very loud.

Excellent food and quick and friendly service. Only issue is we made a reservation for 12 and got there a little early but they do not open until exactly 12. Would be better to have a bit of a buffer, allow reservations starting at 12:15 then.

Great food. Very tasty. Service was great from hostess to waiter. Music selection was very good. I found myself Shazamming every time. Outside seating was clean and umbrellas are a plus. It’s a restaurant I visit often.

Beautiful water front seating.  Wait staff and servers were are genuinely nice and friendly.  Didn't rush at all.  When in NYC you expect to pay more but prices were all reasonable and the food tasted super fresh and delicious.  Also resturant is gluten free friendly.  We had a great experience.
Last minute reservation made easy for 10 people. Great food, great service, perfect evening and amazing view
Order the pizza or salad. The server was great but the hostess was a little bit rude.

The plates/silverware were dirty. We ordered the steaks medium, they came well done. The watermelon & feta salad is literally 10 large chunks of watermelon with tiny bit of Feta & arugula sprinkled on it.
Wunderbare Aussicht auf den Eastriver, gutes Steak und zuvorkommende Bedienung. Gerne wieder.
Daniel and Veronica are outstanding servers!  Really appreciate them and rare to find such great service .  Thank you

On a beautiful evening Industry Kitchen is the perfect for indoor/outdoor dining. The restaurant allows for views of the water. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. The service service was good. I enjoyed the white sangria but after tasting my friends Schofferhofer grapefruit beer i switched to that. It was so light and fresh. For appetizers we shared the Spanish octopus and Fattoush salad. We both enjoyed the Fattoush salad more. For dinner my friend enjoyed the Pan  Roasted chicken breast and I enjoyed a New York strip steak which came with a double baked potato and asparagus.
Great spot by the water, they made me a cocktail I requested (off their list), great service!

The food was good and the ambiance was nice. However, our waitress completely abandoned us. There was another event happening at the restaurant. She was busy with that and I understand, however, the whole service was rushed. When it was finally time for us to pay for our meal, she was nowhere to be found. When we were ready for her to take the payment, we saw that she was busy with the event, but she would walk by our table, avoided eye contact and act like she didn’t see us waiting for her. It was to the point where we had to signal other waiters. I had to get up from my seat to look for other waiters and ask them to give us our checks and to take it when we were ready. The waiters had to look for her for us twice. Like I said, I understand that she had a lot on her plate, but they could’ve at least assigned our table another waiter/waitress. It was just terrible service overall. Never experienced something like that before honestly; so disappointing.

I love Industry Kitchen. The vibe is always great and you can somehow always get a table. Food is great. The lamb chops with goat cheese and fig jam are insane! Even their vegan pizza options are great. Watermelon arugula salad with salmon is bomb. Drinks are always on point and the view sets this spot apart from other indoor/outdoor spots. The only thing I’d say could use just a bit of improvement is the brunch menu. Most items could use a bit more pizazz in flavor. But that’s literally the only thing and it’s not a big deal honestly. Oh and ask to be seated in Eman’s section. Eman is the absolute best! Make your reservation today. You’ll love it!
The Staff was attentive and did an exceptional job managing the flow of service.  Food and waterfront ambiance enhanced the dining experience.

It was the first beautiful summer evening after many weeks so it was delightful to sit outdoors by the river and enjoy delicious cocktails and share several small plates with my friend. Favorites were the bao buns and the lamb merguez sausages. Service was top notch. Can’t wait to go back!
Had a large party and they made it easy. Sat outside overlooking the water and bridge. Food was great.

The kale salads w/ shrimp was delicious and every last bit eaten and enjoyed.  The same with the Caesar salad with chicken.  One of us had the NY strip steak medium rare and it was done as requested.  Again, nothing left on the plate.  All three of us were very pleased with our meals.  Industry Kitchen is a great location and a favorite place.
We truly enjoyed our dining experience.  The food and ambience were both great!  Our server, Ryan, was outstanding!  He made my birthday celebration very special.

What a great dining experience, perfect summer spot to eat with their indoor/outdoor setup right on the waterfront. Good music selection to keep the crowd buzzing, food was great and fresh. Cocktail menu is very creative: highly recommend

On a sweltering hot summer day Industry Kitchen was both refreshing and energizing.  The food choices were plentiful and delicious.  Service was attentive and friendly.  The open doors gave an option to be indoors with some air conditioning yet enjoy the outdoor patio overlooking the waterfront.  A perfect summertime location.
Great evening for pre concert dinner on the water!
Fun venue with a decent variety of options.  The food was good, and the service was excellent.
The best lobster ravioli i have ever tasted! Great friendly staff and exceptional service.
Drinks were fast.  food was a bit uneven. closeout service (getting bill, etc. ) was a bit off
Food was excellent. Would recommend anything with the lobster. View in the summer is great for enjoying the water. Would definitely return

Small, but tasty portions. Waiter was good, but the hostesses were very rude and awkward. For example, one hostess asked us if we wanted to sit inside and when we said yes, she said we couldn't. It was also super hot that day and there was no accommodation for the heat. Would've gone elsewhere if we didn't have someone with mobility issues.

Great for a drink and a bite by the water. Lobster gazpacho was quite tasty. Truffled potato curls and dip duo were also good. Pizza was so so. Kinda pricey but location and atmosphere are what you're there for

Small portions, wine was served in water cup, not acceptable in my view.  I feel that bread they should be added and definitely a nice proper wine cup since they charged $26 for a cup of wine. I had better dinner experiences for less or same price. No sure I would recommend this place.

This was my first time at this restaurant, great staff, excellent DJ, the food was ok. My daughter loved her Wagyu burger, the Salmon was delicious, I ordered the lobster ravioli, the sauce was great but the lobster meat taste as if it was frozen a little too long. Otherwise, great place to visit. Will visit again.

Industry Kitchen is perfectly located at the water's edge of the East River. It's a casual, very energetic, environment. I had the Lobster Cobb Salad, which was delicious, however, at $30 for a salad, I would expect a good portion of lump lobster meat as if it came from a good-sized lobster tail. Instead, I received tiny pieces of lobster meat scattered on the salad. Very disappointing. I asked the waitress to recommend a draft beer because I'm a Heineken drinker and it wasn't an option, so she pointed out the first draft beer listed and I don't recall the name. It was delicious, went perfectly with my salad, and was unlike the bite of Heineken. As the meal progressed, the music volume was vastly elevated making a conversation a bit challenging. Overall, this is an excellent spot for meeting up with friends.

Great experience. Went for a dinner on a Sunday with my sister and little niece who was visiting. Food was amazing and they made the cutest Shirley temple for my niece! The server- I think Isabelle was her name, was so good to us and even though we asked her to take a picture of us and took our time ordering, and all the things that come with a little kid she was so great! I always love bringing visiting guests here for a meal on the water.
Excellent food, view, service!  Highly recommend and will go back again

A real fun outdoor dining experience with great views.  Even though they tell you that you only have the table for 90 minutes, we were there for over 3 hours and nobody said a word!

Would definitely go back.

Only negative is that the seating is on hard benches without back support.
Great meal on the water! Our server was wonderful.
Pizza was tasty, salad were well balanced and delicious, the view was even better!
Great location with a beautiful view on the river. Kid and stroller friendly.

Nicole, our waitress was great 
Very attentive to detail

the food was pretty bad - don't order the steak it was flavorless. also the lobster tacos are so small with barely any lobster. definitely a fun place for drinks but that's about it - stay away from the food
Food and service was good and the location is very impressive
The outdoor space is great, the staff is helpful and friendly. Loved their suggestions.
Lots of food options to choose from.  All the food tasted great.  We had the shishito peppers, gnocchi, pizza and salad with chicken.  Would strongly recommend.

I dined for the first time at their outdoor ￼side bar you’re supposed to order inside and then they bring your food to your table except they never check on you at all and they forgot my Caesar dressing so I had to get up myself and go back to the bar to ask for it just took a while to be able to eat my meal but other than that it was great!

Made a reservation for fathers day and when we got there the table reserved for us had no umbrella which had been moved to shade kids at the next table .it was a really hot day so they put us on another table which also had very little shade . There were a lot of empty better tables : when I asked to move was told they were all booked even though I had a reservation booked in advance and our only option was a table inside in front of the kitchen/ pass. The food and service was good but I was disappointed that I was put at a bad table when there were so many others available. It’s a nice location with water views so being inside in front of the kitchen on a sunny day was a bummer . In spite of being busy the food was good and came quickly .
Food was great. Except that the waiter wasn't happy with his tip.
This is the 2nd time I've come to IK and will be back often. Love the food drinks & vibe of this place.

I went after work with my work wife. We shared everything. We ordered the Kungpao Broccoli, the Meat & Cheese board, the Lobster Ravioli and the Bruschetta and Prosciutto pizza. I wouldn’t order the cheese board or the
Pizza. Everything else was delicious. The white sangria was so refreshing. The s’more dessert was ok. I’ll definitely be back
The service was great! The food and drink are delicious! The staff are amazing! I really enjoy it with my family! Highly recommend this place! Thank you so much!
Had a meal with a view.  The food was average for the city.  Nothing too crazy, very simple with stale bread. No dishes to write home about.
Great atmosphere but the food quality could've been better.

The food quality has declined. Industry Kitchen was once a very nice venue with great eat and service. This Sunday, although our server Natalie was lovely the food was lukewarm, the salad had sour lettuces and the plates were left on the table outside, turned up and birds were hopping from table to table. 
I brought my date here and we ended up at the Tin Building.
Christian gave us great service and we had a lovely Sunday evening
Fantastic range of dishes, all of them top notch food.  would take anybody visiting NYC here for sure
Food was great and so was the service.  Great spot on the water front near Pier 15.  If you haven’t  been you need to go.

I’ve been several times and always want to like it more than I do… The menu has changed and seems very appealing however, food is mediocre.  also we ordered multiple appetizers and they all came out exactly at the same time even though we ￼. Annoying!specifically asked for that not to happen.

I went here to celebrate a family member's birthday. The food was very good and the service was polite and helpful. This was my 4th time at this restaurant and I will definitely be returning--we always have a great time. And the location is fabulous.
Great atmosphere. Good food. Would recommend to a friend.
Loved this place! The atmosphere was so fun, and everyone needs to try the smores dessert!
Brought out of friends to a go to place. Great meal as always. Ryan was an attentive and capable server. Even with the clouds lovely meal.
Wait staff was great, food was delicious, definitely will be back!
Great location!  Service and food were 5⭐️!  Highly recommend!

Delicious food with beautiful views! Decided to come here on a whim and got a reservation for brunch that same afternoon, service was fantastic even though they were quite busy. The atmosphere near the water is lovely, although on a particularly hot day I would recommend sitting inside. They had most of the slide away walls open so you will still get fresh air and beautiful views, but benefit from the AC. 

Definitely recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes! They were fantastic, and the portion was perfect. My boyfriend loved the lobster omelet too. Would come again!

The appetizers were outstanding. The main courses were okay, but the appetizers were the highlight of the meal. Noise level was pretty high, considering that we were close to the outside seating area, and there was no wall to bounce the sound around.

Didn’t get to eat there with our reservation because we didn’t want to sit under the highway by some boxes and a bunch of junk.  Asked nicely for a new table but every time one opened up there was a reason we couldn’t sit there.  The manager explained to us what a reservation meant twice like we didn’t understand but then also told us they had to hold tables for people who did make reservations (which we did).  Felt like he wanted to push us to the back and out of the way because we had kids.  My husband works a couple blocks away and we are always in the neighborhood but will never go back because of all the excuses and bs.
The food was exceptional. I got the grilled lamb lollipops and the strawberry shortcake waffle. The portions are small relative to the price, bit you're also getting the amazing view.
Food was great however we felt rushed, other than that, the overall experience was good.  Thank you.
Beautiful place with beautiful views and service. Food was good and fairly priced. Highly recommended of you are looking to eat by the seaport.
Lamb lollipops and poke nachos were delicious!  Great date night spot.

The setting is unequalled with spectacular views of the East River bridges and vintage ships moored in the harbor.  The food was well prepared and plated with sizable portions and well-priced in an overpriced NYC restaurant market.  Service was caring without being oversolicitous.  It was a Thursday night and they never rushed us even after the 90 minute limit they claim one has to abide by.  I've dined here twice before and will return for all these reasons, not to mention that its a great place for photos.
everything was great! I don’t remember our servers name but he was great he was training somebody new too! I would 100% return

Great atmosphere, indoor and outdoor. We sat on the outdoor and the weather was great and the view towards Brooklyn was amazing as the lights were coming up. Food great, music great - a place with atmosphere.
Great outdoor space on the river.  Great, friendly service, good food, and reasonable for nyc.
Views are great. Food is good but not worth the price you’re paying for. Personally thought it was overpriced but that’s NYC price.

Everything was perfect. From the service to the drinks and food, everything was good. My inly suggestion is to add another lamb chop, instead of two. Those were so good I am still thinking about them days later. The salmon and roasted vegetables were also top tier. Our server was the best and her recommendations were on point. I will be returning!
Hosts were unprofessional. Had 3 hosts but so slow because of chatting and acting like they work in fine dining restaurant. Can easily tell that the owner is not there.
Ran 30 minutes late to my reservation and was still seated without a wait. Very considerate service if a bit slow. Overall a pleasant evening and somewhere I would return to!
Our waiter and bus staff were absolutely lovely. But they were understaffed! So we waited for things. Otherwise great day

Nice server. Host could have been friendlier. Big thing was just that the food was meh. Pizza was hard and way too thick. Mussels average. Dips below average. Salad okay size but could tell it was a bottled sauce and nothing fresh.
Great Mothers Day experience! We would recommend for anyone in the Seaport area!
I’m never disappointed by this restaurant, love it!!

Beautiful setting on the pier at south street seaport. Our server and manager were great. The restaurant was very busy and the kitchen could not keep up with the orders. Certain items we ordered that were supposed to be hot were served cold or never heated. The pizzas with gluten free crust and cocktails were delicious!
Great for large groups, excellent efficient fast service, very good food, superb location…what’s not to like

While the menu was good the kitchen was clearly struggling to handle the large number of guests as my main course (short-rib Benedict) was stone cold and my daughter's caesar salad was over-dressed. But on a sunny day you can't beat the setting...
Out door dinning
Food was so delicious and friendly service. Crowded and tight seating is the only downside.
The food, drinks and wait staff were amazing!  I highly recommend it.

The service was rude and insisted that we pay a minimum per person to get two tables. We did end up paying but they connected the tables instead even if we said it wasn't necessary. Our group was a little uncomfortable and hunched over a small space when there were plenty of tables and chairs around. Just didn't like the policy and the service, it didn't make sense to us.
Great casual place, very solid food quality, friendly service!

First time being there for brunch. It was a nice day and we sat outside.

Food was good, hot, tasty and came very quickly.

Our server was friendly and made sure we had everything we wanted.

I will be back for more.

Service was horrible. It was at least 20 minutes before the waiter even came to ask us for drink order. Then the food arrived all at once, starters and main together for some of us and not all - there were 5 of us. The waiter didn’t really reappear until it was time to pay the bill which we waited for 30 minutes to do. Overall, food doesn’t merit the price and crappy service.
Good food and service , would definitely come back
They were very rude. No flexibility of adjusting a big group.
A very close place to get out of the rain on a rainy Sunday evening.  The soup was really good, the rest was just average.

Superb view on the brooklyn bridge and brooklyn Heigts. Nevertheless, the vision in the plates are not so gorgeous.
Very small portion for lobster poke. Pizza is just avergae and the wines are far too expensive as compared to the quality (you have very little choice also).
Kathy and the other host and our server were all fantastic!
Just a ferry ride from our home in rockaway very much worth the trip.

Definitely more of a touristy spot - food was mediocre, wine selection was delish! A photographer took our pic and let us keep one for free which was really fun!! Would go back for just small bites and drinks!
First visit for the year and they continue to be a favorite!
Great spot on the water! And great pizza, very busy on a Saturday night so service a bit slow but otherwise great night
Watermelon feta salad was perfect for the warm day!

This was a jewel of a find! On the water, beautiful scenery and the kindest and quickest service. Ambiance was oh so friendly and the staff was ever present for refills on drinks, additional items and desert. The layout is wheelchair and child friendly to seating areas. Highly recommend for anyone looking for delicious food, and very comfortable atmosphere.
Many wonderful entrees but pizza is excellent as well. Watermelon gazpacho is great.
Excellent food at affordable price, however the service is confused and sometimes they make mistakes with your order.
Un bon moment dans ce resto au bord des quais. Un peu cher mais C’est New York . Endroit très sympa
Decided to go out for brunch while visiting NY, very spur of the moment. Location was very nice, food and service was great. Would return next time I’m in NY.
Great spot on the river - looking forward to warmer weather to really enjoy the space.  Got to try the Honeybee pizza - honey + pizza? It was delish! so was the Purple Butterfly cocktail!!
Everything was great, except we didn’t feel our server was attentive.  It wasn’t super busy.  We would’ve ordered more drinks and food had he come check in with us more often.

A frequent diner to this restaurant location with a view. Food to feast your eye and dining experience. Crispy bacon and fries with soft scrabble eggs cooked to perfection. Lobster tacos is a must-have signature dish. Great service as soon as you arrive and throughout your meal.

It’s a nice restaurant to visit when the weather is nice 
Especially if you live in the area

It wasn’t my first time. and I am sure I’ll be back :) That should tell you something! I like everything about this place (food, service, and location) - except 1. the noise level (I think it gets really loud especially when you are seated close to the bar area.) and 2. the restrooms might need a bit more attention.
They won’t give me a receipt. They are in the financial district; people go there for business lunches. They should provide receipts

Surprisingly good service considering how big and spread out it is and being enclosed in little houses it’s not easy to get your waiter’s attention. But someone was always popping in to check on us. Food was great and fast.
Very slow, not very friendly staff. Waited way too long for the service.
I had a great experience, the service was really nice and the view was really amazing, especially for pictures.
Nice ambience, food and view. I will definitely be back :)
Our food was outstanding . We absolutely loved our room and the ambiance !!!
Outdoor setting is awesome; wait staff couldn’t have been kinder. Wonderful views - go and enjoy!
Open air dining with a water view of lower Manhattan. Staff is always friendly and attentive. Ample lobster meat in signature lobster tacos is a must to order.
Enjoyed the waitress and the pulled pork bao appetizer. Weren’t too crazy about the truffle fries. Would still recommend.
The staff were nice but the glasses and napkins were not clean and the food was overpriced. Tourist trap.
Was just a great experience . For me the music inside was too loud . And our salad had very little to no taste . But loved the restaurant , location etc

Lovely place. We were at a table but felt chilly with the doors open. They seated us in one of the little greenhouses. Loved it. They were very accommodating. Our server Ish was friendly, polite and attentive.
Tuna nachos delicious, all the pizzas, salads would recommend

Industry Kitchen was a fabulous experience. From the ambiance being on the water front with views of Brooklyn across the water and lower Manhattan is the best. We got a mini house outside and today was perfect for it not being cold. The food came out very quickly and all dishes were perfect. Honeybee pizza is for anyone who doesn't want the Diablo which is spicy. I had mini lamb chop lollipops, lobster taco and greek salad with shrimp. Definitely try this for large groups or a cute date in the mini house.
Food was amazing and service was really good. I would go back

Brussels were sorely disappointing. Bao buns weren’t great and pizza was good, but not amazing. For the price, we hoped for higher food quality. But the location is fantastic and our waiter gave great service.

I mentioned when booking that we were celebrating my husbands birthday it was not acknowledged nor was I offered any kind of desert for my kids to sing happy birthday to their father. I understand that the seating time is limited it wasn’t a very memorable experience as the outside heater kept cutting off.

Food was very mediocre - came out very quickly which meant it was premade and sitting in the kitchen for a long time.  Salad was not fresh and the grilled chicken was likely to have been grilled was so overcooked, hard and inedible.

I hadn't been to Industry Kitchen in quite some time and was glad the food and service had not changed. The host at the front desk was pleasant, he pronounced my name correctly, the wait staff was on point and the food was delicious!
Really beautiful view, but the food is mediocre. I would recommend the place for the ambience only.
Sat outside in the sun…friendly service from Caleb and the team.  It’s a great place.
Service was incredibly slow. It was almost as if they needed more servers
Great food and ambiance. A little privy, bit worth it

Absolutely loved the vibe, the mini houses was nice and warm, our server OJ was super sweet, attentive, and provided great service. The steamed mussels were delicious and will definitely go back for more
Great spot with fantastic food and service!! Will be back soon.
So good! The marshmallow s’mores dessert is HUGE. The pasta was really good too. The little houses outside are surprisingly a vibe! More of a vibe than the inside.
It was okay. Nothing to rave about. Pizza was great. Our server was great, made the experience worth while.
Our server Iman was a wonderful server. Very attentive and our food came out wonderful. Will definitely be coming back. 10/10
Our server Brandon was fantastic and the ambience/view was phenomenal. Would return
The service was so nice and willing to come back if we weren’t ready. All food recommended was very good. The inside on Monday night was too loud to talk so we sat outside.
The service was great and the food was amazing! Not to mention the location was perfect.
Service was great, food was very mediocre and overrated.
