The waiter, the food, the place and the ambience were perfect.
Great food - great service!

This food is good on a reasonable budget when you want to spend , but also not spend too much. People may think “chicken” is just chicken, but not here! And the lamb chops , perfection! Melts in your mouth, and if you’re big and drinking an alcoholic beverage, and you like tea. They have a combination of both. Perfect for this winter season. ! Winter cider is AMAZING!
It was great! I’m sad I didn’t get to say hi to my aunt in law Rachel though. Overall, great food and amazing experience!

I’ve visited Industry Kitchen multiple times in the past, and have always appreciated the overall experience at this restaurant. While food and drink can get a bit pricey, some of the dishes are absolutely worth coming back for.
Service was poor and food decent but overpriced.  Plus the waiter tagged on automatically a 22% service charge without one's consent.
A great casual date night
Industry is one of my go to places in new York. I’m never not happy there. Love the food, the drinks are great.

The lobster ravioli is awesome!
Sitting near a large loud family inside is not the move!
It's incredible, the location, the food, the attention.. everything was great 😊 we'll be back!!
We sat in the Outdoor heated mini house which was an amazing experience! Food was delicious, ambience was amazing - perfect date night!

Dine in the mini houses, cute date night. Music was good,  Service was top tier, food was amazing and drinks was good and strong. Prices are reasonable example, 4 drinks, 2 appetizers, 2entire and 2 dessert came up to $210 added a tip $250/270. Definitely recommend this place and will be going back. FYI if you go on Sunday brunch stops at 4pm then dinner menu starts at 5pm so in between those times you can order drinks, appetizers and pizza but I wouldn’t miss the dinner food was that good
Disappointed because  they don’t serve large plate meal menu lunch. Only available at dinner time:(

I really wanted to love this place, but the food fell short. We started off with the meatballs and crab cake. Meatballs were excellent until I bit into one and felt a hard block, looked like a pit of some sort. Crab cake was definitely microwaved, but the aioli had a great flavor. Drinks were okay. The cosmopolitan I ordered had proseco in it, I’m not sure why, and the second round I could taste espresso in the glass so they served it in a dirty glass with espresso still in it from their espresso cocktail that can be found on the menu. My husband had the Ceaser salad, which was great. I had the lobster omelette which lacked flavor and was luke warm. Ambiance is beautiful. Really lovely view. We would try it again.
The food did take a while to get to our table, but it was worth the wait. The food was delicious.

Even though it was Valentine’s Day and there was a 1.5 hour seating limit the staff was courteous  allowing us to remain in our booth for close to 2 hours. The server was friendly and attentive and the food quality was excellent and came out quick.
Excelente servicio, la comida nos encanto, el ambiente es perfecto con la vista del E. River, el Brooklyn Bridge y muy fácil de llegar debajo del FDR..!

Great food , nice views of the East River ,
Brooklyn and the Brooks bridge. Good service and I thought the prices were reasonable
Great food and service would definitely recommend.
Solid restaurant week menu. We really enjoyed our time. Thank you for taking great care of us!
Nice spot for a leisure meal.
Perfect!!!
food was great, service was very very quick, and prices were good. great value for the price. definitely would recommend to others and will return.
Lobster wonton tacos and braised short rib bao buns were awesome! Server was cute and patient.
The staff was so attentive. Food came quickly and piping hot. I went during restaurant week. Food options were great. I would definitely visit agsin when back in NYC.
We very much enjoyed the food. The only jarring note was that everything came out almost immediately and all together. That made the meal feel rushed.

We love the outdoor seating in the igloo.  Great view of East River, Brooklyn, and Brooklyn Bridge.  The menu had a good selection of seafood and meat.  We ordered the diver scallop, crab cake, salmon, and NY steak.  Everything was fresh, visually appealing, and on point.  For dessert, my husband surprised me with the chocolate lava cake with sparklers on top.  Delicious!  It was accented with mashed up cherries to complement the rich dark chocolate.
No view of the Brooklyn Bridge as advertised. But food was great! The huts were warm and quiet. We enjoyed our dinner.
There is NO "Hit or Miss" here this place is a hidden GEM in plain sight. Outstanding Food ... A little Pricey but the service and ambiance makes it all worth it
Very good nice heaters in the igloo

It was our first time at this restaurant. The mini house was so cute, heated, and fun. The views are great. We had lunch reservations, the steak and eggs were cooked to perfection, the pepperoni pizza was tasty, my drink “side car” was made differently than I am used to but still good. 

The cost is moderate. Our server was amazing, upbeat, funny, easy going, constantly checking on us, his name was something that began with “Ant”, sorry we don’t remember his name. 
He’s younger, braids, glasses, he was amazing. 

When next I’m back in NYC I’ll live to visit in the summer. 

Amazing food and service.
The artichoke pizza is a must try. So flavorful with super fresh ingredients.

It was my boyfriend’s birthday. Anibal was our server and everything from the service, down to the food was amazing. We loved the private houses for outside dining. It gave us a more secluded feeling. Thank you Anibal for making our first experience at Industry Kitchen a memorable one, we will definitely be back.
Loved sitting in the tiny houses outside with friends

Food was just okay. But the Beurremont Burrata was exceptional. Chocolate mousse was served in four tiny chocolate 'cups', and each had whipped cream--they were also sitting in a very small amount of whipped cream (which kind of melted and therefore didn't look intentional but more like they were trying to cover up a spill. It was a nice idea, but for me there was way too much whipped cream and not enough mousse at all. Also, when I ordered a latte, it came in a glass cup, and the coffee seemed very weak.

We liked our server a lot, but he never was around. I always had to ask someone else to tell him we wanted to order, or we were ready for the dessert menu, or the check, etc. (btw, the place was only half full) When we left, we had to actually interrupt a group of servers (who were just standing around talking) just to get out of the restaurant. 

There was a very odd element to this place. A professional photographer was roaming around the place asking to take pictures of the customers. One family with small children next to us agreed. But I didn't really like the intrusion on our lunch.

The place itself is so gorgeous. So beautiful, and the view of the water is great. The only big problem is that you have to endure the smell of diesel from the boats, which is a big deterrent. 

All in all, it's not a terrible place, but it's not great either.

Nice place to go for a date night. Did not like that the glasses for wine were cloudy and not proper wine glasses. Service was excellent though. If you’re looking for a fancier vibe this isn’t the place. Very laid back.
Un posto molto originale fuori di giri turistici
Nice location, great music, and delicious food. Enjoyed nachos and pizza. Definitely coming back.
Great fun in the greenhouse dining zone. Food was superb and service brilliant.
Repas de nouvelle année dans un petite serre à l extérieur au bord de l eau , portions hyper copieuses, service top

Una magnífica experiencia. Atención y calidad insuperables.
Y la mini house, un acierto.
Loved the mini house experience. It was warm and cozy.
The restaurant and staff were amazing. The outdoor pods were a great experience. The food was amazing. Would definitely do this restaurant again.
Location, food and service were amazing! Definitely recommend this place!
Great location and the food and service were outstanding! We ate outside in one of the little units, very nice!

Food and location were good, for service we cannot say the same, worse surely. The waitress was annoyed after receiving the tipping, she wanted more even though she hadn’t served us the dinner. We thought that tipping was appropriate, never mind. Last but not least she described us as unpolite.. I’m sorry if the tipping has not been as high as she wished, but the cordiality towords clients wins, always.
Excelent restaurant , the service was perfect and the food so good
Fun dining in the outdoor houses! Service was good even with the staff having to come in and out. Nice menu and my artichoke and mushroom pizza was delicious.
Great for a family lunch. 3 pizzas and a salad was enough food for 5 people to share.

First night in New York and thought we would try this place as it was close to our hotel. Overall, it was just poor to ok. We ordered the truffle potato twists as an appetizer which came out cold. The margarita pizza barely had any cheese on it (for the style of a margarita). They messed up another pizza (added sausage to it when we didn’t order it) and ultimately had to pay for another pizza to replace it. Server was not attentive at all. It was downright annoying… we had to literally wave our hands and flag him down several times for soda refills for our kids even though the place was not crowded. No ranch dressing at all for pizza, small thing but really no ranch dressing in the entire restaurant??? Food was prepared fast, which was a plus. Nice location and very nice holiday decorations but as far as ambience, the loud music was out of balance relative to the amount of people in the restaurant which in my opinion killed the ambiance. Overall, didn’t get the value for the money spent and can’t say I recommend this place.

It was Christmas Eve.  We ate in one of the “igloos”, which had a heater, but it was so cold outside it wasn’t adequate.  The heater barely took the chill off & every time the server opened the door it let heat out.  Food was good & service was good- just cold!
Food and cocktails weren’t great. The cheese on margarita pizza is hard to chew may be because of extreme weather. The ambience and service is great.
Amazing food atmosphere and service our server was so attentive especially being outdoors in the igloos. It was freezing! But Andrew was kind patient and upbeat! Will come here again!
Great service, unique setting (our own cabana by the water), good food.
The food, server, and view was amazing. I wish there was another heater in the outdoor tent, one wasn't enough to keep us warm. Other than that we had an amazing time.
Very enjoyable evening!
Our server Ryan was amazing. He was kind and attentive and the food was amazing. We would highly recommend and come again.
Khalib was our server. He did an amazing job making sure we had an amazing night. Would highly recommend this place too anyone in the area.
Delicious dinner! Lovely staff. Beautifully decorated for Christmas!

We sat in their glass house.  The ambiance was fun and festive.  The staff were friendly.  The food was surprisingly good.  The only thing I would change is for them to have some sort of shade available to prevent direct sunlight.  It was uncomfortable for our guests as they stared directly into the sun.  The bathroom situation was a bit odd since both bathrooms were unisex.  I can understand why they did it, it was just a weird feeling seeing men when I entered the bathroom.  Otherwise, I would highly recommend and we’d dine there again.
Wonderful green house lunch. Great experience. Food, service, location, vibe, all great.
Industry Kitchen was so nice especially during Christmas time! The outdoor mini houses created a great holiday ambiance and we really enjoyed! Food was so delicious too.
Beautiful set up great food great service and lovely hosts

Me encanto el
Ambiente y el servicio. 
Puedo volver
Food was great tasting and portions were good.  Definitely going back again.
Thank you for making my birthday a special one!! Delicious food, super fast service and great menu choices! If you have not been to Industry Kitchen you are missing out!! Book your reservation now :)

Great food with a great ambiance. We sat outside in the mini houses. Although a little tight for 4 people with winter coats, still a very cozy setting. The food came out super fast, like a little too fast. They could have spaced out the appetizers and entrees a little more. Overall, a great dining experience.
Good is always great, service is efficient and pleasant! And a great venue all year around!
Being in the little outside bubble tent at sunset was perfect.  Food and mocha martini were excellent!

This was hands down the best brunch I have had in QUITE SOME TIME. Our last outing in New York before heading to the airport, grabbed some friends and an igloo table outside and had such an amazing time here. Beautiful views! Amazing food. The bao buns are insane, the potato curds cured my hangover <3 - Drinks amazing and service outstanding. Ryan deserves an entire review to himself - he was the best server we've had in New York. So genuine, kind, and really tied our overall experience together in a bow. Cannot recommend this place enough! xoxo, hayley + friends
Will return - phenomenal service

Awesome place for a date!
Not expensive on my opinion and the food was exelent!
Food was underwhelming especially for the price. I liked the mini houses for the holidays but I would not come back.
It was an awesome experience.  The mini house is nice and warm. The food was soooo good and the waiter was amazing.  He was such a sweetheart.

Great food, service and ambiance! Felt very festive for the holidays in the outdoor greenhouse decorated for the holidays. Made for a cozy and romantic vibe! Will definitely be back and recommend for sure!
Mussels, Crab Cake, and Lobster Ravioli amazing!! Music was amazing. Ish our waitress was amazing as well. This place never disappoints. If you want good food with great views this is the place.

My boyfriend and I went for lunch and had the best experience! We sat outside inside a very warm greenhouse! It was a great view. We each ordered a pizza and a few alcoholic beverages. The food and drinks were awesome! We had such a great time. Highly recommend.
The food was great, had festive Christmas decor, the service was top notch, our server ISH was the best, giving her a shout out right here
The outdoor cabins are great!
Great food and staff.  Quick service.  Great location on the water.

The food was fabulous, and the ambience and view in the outdoor seating were beautiful. I highly recommend the lamb lollipops and pumpkin crème brûlée. The servers were quick and attentive. It was a great dining experience!
Great food, excellent service. Get the steak, you wont be disappointed.
I went for brunch on a rainy Sunday and the ambiance and sight over the East river were amazing. Delicious brunch, totally recommended!
Industry Kitchen is great for the reasons mentioned
We went on Thanksgiving and the views were amazing. The food was pretty good, some things were great but others just average. Overall we would go back because of the views and friendly staff

We decided to sit outside and either they forgot about us but we had to wait 15 minutes for the waiter to take our order. I know we live in the city but there were rats running around, we took a chance and hope the inside doesnt have rat issues.
Varied menu, reasonable prices and good food with a festive atmosphere.
Our server was attentive and friendly, food is subpar, flavorless, and everything tastes like it’s frozen vs. freshly made.

The outdoor private houses are heated and super cute for winter. Our server was absolutely amazing and the food is solid! One hostess was an absolute horror. She said there wasn’t availability around 2pm so we made a reservation (that was available on Open Table along with many other time slots) for 2:15 and told her we’d be back in 15 …. she went on to tell us that we still wouldn’t be able to sit then because there were other reservations before us? Made no sense, because the place was far from full and why would the reservation be available if it wasn’t… available? After a way too long argument which ended in her saying a dismissive “okay” and me giving up, we came back 15 mins later at 2:15 and were seated immediately and had a great experience. Would have been a 5 star review if not for this awful hostess.

Service was excellent, accurate and very prompt. Food was hot, prepared well and seasoned perfectly.  Three of us got the big breakfast and one the Hunter omelet. All were excellent. Only one of us took a photo.  Caleb was our server and was fantastic. Will definitely be back.

Went for lunch mid week. Portions were very nice sizes. Salsas are good for sharing if you’re going to have an app. I had the October. Was very very good. What’s er the sauce was ( I didn’t lol back to check) was amazing.
o had an espresso martini that was yummy but a smaller than I usually get at similar restaurants. Although it was not packed I did feel a little rushed and was confused since they’re just opened for lunch and weren’t even there for an 1 and half. But our waitress was knowledgeable and gave some good suggestions.
I’d go back if ever in the are again but wouldn’t seek it out.
Great view- lovely food & drinks with friendly staff and greeting

We loved everything about our dining experience at this restaurant.  The food, service and quaint little outside “tents” were wonderful.  The staff and management were kind, courteous and so attentive.  The waterfront location is “icing on the cake”!

It took a while for our group of 10 to get our server but once someone came, we were taken cared of.

The food was amazing!

This was a stunningly loud restaurant even by NYC standards, although a large private party in the bar may have made it exceptionally so on this evening. However, on request, we were readily reseated in an outside cabin, as far from the nearest loudspeaker as possible and with a clear river view. A thumbs up for good customer service. Friendly and attentive service throughout after that, too. Vegetarian members of our party spoke well of their pizzas. Carnivores were satisfied with their steaks and chops—decent value for Lower Manhattan waterfront dining.
Inside it was too loud to talk with our 9 person group. We ended up leaving as soon as possible to another bar that was quieter.
great location and tasty menu.  November 7th was 75+degrees and we dined outside under umbrellas
Great view right by the river. Nice boardwalk for before and after the dinner. The meal is like a tapas style. Cozy sitting. It would be even better in a summer day.

Our server was awesome but the food was below average, particularly the pizza.  Frozen pizza would have tasted better. This place is in a great location and really liked the open concept, but they need to do much better on the food!

Amazing location great waitstaff but the food wasn’t the best.  I don’t order bread baskets often (like once a year) so when I do it’s a treat.  It was the worst bread basket I’ve ever had (stale, and taste like it was picked up from the corner store) I shared it was stale and I think I got the same bread, just toasted…and it was $9.  The one cheap thing restaurants can do well is bread. The kale salad looked good but was missing something.  The patio is amazing, but you can get the view for free.
Poor service and the food was bland and not tasty!

The food and service were beyond the expectations.
We had a party of 7 people they called us in advance and were very accommodating.
Awesome experience for group of 12! Very fun, friendly service, lots of food  options and reasonably priced.
Love the location, food was excellent and cocktails were yummy!
Visiting our daughter
Food was awesome, wait staff were very attentive. Will definitely be back
A smoked salmon sandwich arrived 20 minutes after the other entrees. No apologies or adjustment to bill.  Beautiful setting. Limited menu.  Awful service.

Outdoor experience is much better than indoors for dinner. Bar table was not big enough to accommodate everything for a true sit down meal. Very awkward and uncomfortable. Our table was right next to the bar and people kept knocking into our table as well.
Nice location, food was ok but not  great very small portions, very underwhelming.  Wouldn't go back - go next store to the tin building and eat from the food stalls and grab an outside table
The service as well as the food was great as usual.
Everything was great, and I loved the communication
Great atmosphere to be outside on the water, very relaxing. Great service. Food was great - especially the Mexican Street Corn soup!
Wonderful brunch experience. Incredible service and timely seating with reservation time honored.

The interior is nice and I like that you have the option to choose indoor seating or outdoor seating. One of my party member was running late, but I'm glad the host was nice enough to let the rest of my party and I in to sit. We went in at a earlier time, but the area got loud when more people started to join in. The food is good, but the pork belly pizza wasn't as impressive as we thought it'll be. My friend wanted a second drink, but the service was busy so it end up taking a while. The place does take reservations and accepts payment in card.
This restaurant has very good food, friendly and professional employees, and is in a fantastic location very close to the Brooklyn Bridge and with stunning views over at Brooklyn

The food was delicious. Ish waited on our table and was so sweet. I have a gluten allergy, and they were very knowledgeable and helpful in choosing the most delicious gluten-free dish — lobster omelette. I highly recommend. I will be back for sure. They also had a photographer, who was taking pictures of guests and offering the photos free of charge in the form of a postcard. Very nice touch!
Great food and service!

It's nice being by the water. Unfortunately, our waiter wasn't good at his job. Our entrées came out five minutes after they just brought the appetizer and weren't that hot; as a result, we had to eat the entrée before the appetizer otherwise they would have been very cold by the time we ate them. Overall, this was disappointing.
Food was great! Came out quickly, service was great. I was 15 min late, and it was no problem. Sat us right away. I really appreciated that since traffic in NY is unfortunate.

Came for lunch to celebrate after our son got married at City Hall!  Was a beautiful day, beautiful view, great food and great service!
Thank you!
What a great time at Industry Kitchen! The food was delicious and our waiter Brian was so nice with a great sense of humor. A repeat visit is needed!!
Waitress grilled me from across the room and harassed me for tip. Just plain rude gave me no time.

Excellent meal in a great location with very attentive staff.
Noise levels are very high but you do get used to it. There was a degree of over service in that they were trying to deliver main course while we were still eating appetizers.
Overall one of our best meals in US.
Great food for a reasonable price. And very nice staff (Lola)
The server was wonderful. He was so nice and friendly, as well as attentive.  We will remember, however, that one side order of bacon easily feeds three!
Chicken was bland and no one asked if we wanted dessert.

The obvious priceless view was appreciated.  Our server (whose name  I want to say Marcus?  Forgive me if incorrect) was absolutely spot on,  tentative, friendly, patient.  Food was tasty, drinks were also very good.  Perfect all around.  Cheers see you soon !
Great weather made this great location a wonderful experience!
The food was delicious, but our entrees came out while we’re still eating our appetizers.

Great energy and service. Steak entree was just ok. Potato and asparagus tasted reheated and streak was thin with lots of grizzle. The burratta appetizer was fantastic. However $16 for the cocktail in the juice glass was a bit high. But again, the location and service was outstanding!
Great food and great service.  The views of the East River and Brooklyn are amazing!

Seever was great!
Beautiful setting with delicious food. 
Difficult to hear but that seems to be the case throughout the city.
Had dinner with business colleague and weather was PERFECT so able to sit outside. Wonderful experience and will definitely come back!!

Industry Kitchen was close to our hotel. A fast walk. We were in for a quick business meeting. It was nice to be near the water. The hostess was very accommodating when we arrived early for our reservation. The server and bus person were quick to take our orders and bring drinks. They didn’t have a great wine selection, but the food was very flavorful. We order salmon and the baked chicken. We also ordered an hummus and ricotta appetizer. It was delicious!
Food and service were great! Nice view and great ambience for dinner with a friend.
Our waiter seemed distracted at times but overall experience was very good for our party of six.
Good vibes, great location, decent food
Excellent place on the water. Great views.
Good food, pleasant staff.

It’s a great experience for a single diner. I went on a Saturday afternoon and had what I call The Blue Meal - Blueberry Frozé, Maryland Blue Crab Cake plate and Crème Brûlée with blueberries and strawberries. Exquisite! At my server Ish’s recommendation, the meal was just the balance I wanted in sweet and savory. Ish was very pleasant and accommodating. I had enough time to take in the view while enjoying every dab of the spicy aioli sauce that accompanied the crab cake. 

The crab cake! Bursting with crab!!! Lots of places give you breadcrumbs with some crab sprinkled here and there…Not Industry Kitchen. Had a great time. Will be back.
I would give the service 5 stars but our first waiter was just not into providing service. However our second server was excellent.
Good experience and food, plates and glasses were not clean
Love it.  Great water views and lots of atmosphere. Our server was attentive and the food came out very quickly. The food was excellent.  Great menu.
There was plen
Food was meh and it was annoyingly loud

First of all, the staff and the manager were very nice. I can't say a bad word about them except to say there were not enough staff to cover all the tables so it was extremely difficult to get service. 

The food, on the other hand, was absolutely atrocious. I booked a table for 10 people. At least 5 of the 10 sent the food back. The "Chef" is unskilled and under qualified. We ordered pancakes. An extremely basic dish to make. The pancakes we were served were obviously pre-packaged and microwaved. Foul beyond belief! The eggs were supposed to be over-easy. They were all cooked hard. The potato curls had obviously come out of the freezer and been reheated - awful texture, equally awful flavour, dry and unappetizing. To say that I was extremely disappointed would be a gross understatement. I would certainly not recommend ANYONE to this restaurant. If you want to eat while enjoying the views I would suggest you either buy from any other of the many restaurants in the area or you pack a picnic from home and enjoy that. Do not waste your time and money here.
Host and waitstaff were excellent. They accommodated a mistake in our reservation with courtesy and professionalism.

Loved the staff. Super attentive! I wish we had been seated closer to the water than the street… I made reservations the week before. Overall, the food was very good, restaurant has nice views and the wait staff was extremely friendly.

This was second time I came here. The first was excellent the second was very disappointing. Great for drinks and pizza, everything else on the menu is very lack luster. There are certainly better restaurants just a few minutes away if you want dishes other than pizza. Service was great! Just bummed about the quality+taste of food.

Our server was so fantastic! She should work somewhere with better food and drinks.  The location is very nice. The bathrooms were confusing - all gender bathrooms still work better when a little separated (and clean). I will not return.

This is a really nice place to eat when the weather is good. We had a large group and had an outdoor table, which was perfect for us. While they were out of a few of the beer choices for some in our group, everyone was happy with what they got. Service is excellent and friendly. Our server, Isabelle, was fantastic.
Second time I have been there.  Both times, great service and great food.
The Caesar Salad was awesome highly recommend!  Also loved the pepperoni pizza!
What a great place to be on a beautiful day. Food and vibe were great
Great experience overall,  the food was delicious. I especially enjoyed the Huevos Ranchero. Also the ambience of the outdoor seating near the water brought an added flare.
Didn’t think the food was worth the price tag. Our server was great, but seemed to have too many tables which delayed our service
Great quality lamb lollipops and pizza!
We had a great time. We will definitely revisit the restaurant.
Greatest lobster tacos of my life!! Thankful I visited on the recommendation of a friend.
Even with the reservation the wait time was additional 15 mins. The service was slow but waiter did apologize for the wait time.
Great Food and Beautiful View.
We loved it. The food was surprisingly delicious and portions were very generous. Loved watching the world go by from our outside table. And our server was delightful.
Great location, great menu, friendly staff.  Had a great time!

The food was at best, just fine.  The octopus was very overcooked. My caesar salad was small and mediocre.  the risotto had far too much truffle oil in it.  Everything was edible, but for the cost and quality, I don't think I'll be back.  There are plenty of better restaurants in nyc to eat at.
The duck risotto was delicious as was the chocolate dessert
So good, coming back for every NYC trip in the future
Excellent setting with great view on Brocklyn sunset. Food is great and selection of craft beers is fantastic.
The waiter got the order wrong. The gluten-free pizza was tasteless and doughy. The filling for lobster taco was good, but we didn’t get the Chinese noodle shell.
Awesome service and the food was delicious. It was a bit expensive but it was worth the cost

Food was very good. 

The wine selection by the glass was very limited and not all of it seemed fresh, specifically the Cabernet Sauvignon (by the glass), did not taste fresh, it tasted fizzy like perhaps too much carbon dioxide in it.  

The service and the view were outstanding!

I've never written a bad review before but feel compelled to alert others about our experience at Industry Kitchen. Some friends and I went there to celebrate my wife's birthday.  When we entered the receptionist checked us in and wished my wife a happy birthday and that was it.  No further recognition. We were seated outside at a table for four.  The noise level, particularly the blaring music made it almost impossible to hear each other.  While waiting for one of our guests to arrive,  two of us ordered iced tea.  A little while later the waiter returned to tell us the iced tea 'machine' was broken.  We ordered a number of small plates.   Three of us tried the mussels  but they literally were inedible.  The waiter was told about it but did nothing.  Among the other plates the ahi tuna nachos were notable for their almost total lack of tuna.  What was included were literally pea size pieces of tuna surrounded by lots of cabbage, avocado, etc.  The crab cake, the margarita pizza and the bianca pizza were just okay but nothing special.  The wines and the tequila cocktail were fine.   But everything was so disappointing that our friends insisted on going elsewhere for dessert  and to celebrate the birthday.
I've been here before and enjoyed it once again. This time for dinner.
Food was great but service was incredibly slow and our waitress would not stop by our table
Quick bite before a concert at Pier 17…. Perfect spot.

Met a friend who works in area for lunch.  breezy out, sat inside/outside, inside area open to outside.  I had rose he had beer. Split Marguerita pizza plus meatballs and sausage pinwheels. Sausage is actually one sausage long piece coiled , also pepperoni pieces, potato pieces, grns, small plates are larger than at some places. We took a couple of the pizza slices home.
All very tasty, hard to recognize/catch servers as they whiz by to cover large area but not an issue.
Pleasant meal.
It was a pleasant experience.

Food here never disappoints. It’s fantastic! 
The service on the weekend is not consistent. At times it was really good, but other times I found myself frustrated when I had not seen our waiter for about 20 minutes and we just wanted the check. 
Better spot for a date mid-week when it’s less busy.
The Server was great. The atmosphere was good. The
Lovely place for brunch outdoors. Service was impeccable, and the atmosphere lively, with delicious food and many options for the gluten-free and vegetarians.

I noted it was a birthday celebration when making the reservation; and, they had actually asked when I made the reservation online.  However, the day of the actual brunch, the hostess nor the waiter inquired about the celebration.  Why do they ask when you book the reservation, but then when it is the actual day of the meal, no follow-up?

Every time I come to Industry Kitchen I am very satisfied. The food is solid and the atmosphere is great. I have learned that the service staff is always friendly but I do tend to need to ask for things such as water or refills on cocktails. But the staff is always friendly. Caleb was super kind and friendly as well as patient. I enjoyed him. 

The thing that disturbed me this time was seeing the bus boys wearing gloves and touching dirty dishes, then touching my clean water bottle by the opening of the bottle. I have no idea how often the bus boys swap their gloves, but I have a feeling they don’t realize how yucky the gloves are when they are touching clean plates, bottles of water and water glasses. I would prefer to see them not wearing gloves and washing their hands more often. If they were not wearing gloves they would realize how nasty their hands are and I have a feeling would wash their hands more often, in turn keeping the guests plate-ware/ glasses/ silverware more sanitary.

Server was not very friendly and seemed busy, and forgot about us after the food came. There were 7 of us and we all ordered pizza, but the runner wasn’t told who got what, and didn’t know the names of the pizzas.
A wonderful outdoor dining experience.   Our server Kevin was great.  We never felt rushed and the food was wonderful.   We will definitely go back

Natalie our server was super friendly and knowledgable.  Atmospher was perfect.  Food was excellent.  It was a hot night but the space made it a pleasure.
Will definitely return.
The winner from looking around seems to have been the lobster tacos.  My companion ordered and enjoyed thoroughly.
Think they should add BREAKFAST!!!

It's a great vibe with hit and miss food and service.

Even simply cooked food like a steak is problematic. Much better is the meat or cheese platter. Anything cold/assembled can be great as opposed to anything cooked which takes a v-e-r-y long time, is so-so and a very poor value.
The food was amazing!! We had pizzas and the 3lb steak which we shared with the table. The food and service was GREAT
Very limited menu. Pricey, comparable for NY area. Nothing fancy. Bench were a little too close. No chair backs. We won't be returning.

The service was great!  It was a little loud, but that's to be expected.  I had the iced coffee and pancakes, both were very good.  Definitely recommend making a reservation as the place fills up quick.
Awesome good and drinks!!
The food was excellent with the exception of the Spanish octopus which was slightly over cooked and chewy.

This is my 3rd time at Industry Kitchen and I love the food there every time I go.  I will certainly return again and again.  The smoked bacon pizza and burrata salad are two of my favs--out of this world!  The service is always good too, but yesterday Natalie was a-mazing.  I would ask for her by name when returning.
Industry Kitchen is a wonderful place. Natalie was a great server and we had a nice time. we went on a Thursday and the place was jumping!

Very pretty setting and nice staff. Food was mediocre at best. 5 for lunch with no drinks for over $300 CRAZY
Can't believe the charged $5.50 extra for anchovies on a very mediocre Caesar salad. 
Would never go back
Everything was very good. The food was basic but delicious. The service was particularly outstanding
Servixe was slow and off

I’m not going to lie I was a little scared about eating Mexican food in Tribeca. Being a Mexican From California my standards are a bit high for Mexican food. Damn it was delicious!!  From their nachos to their empanadas to their pastor tacos. Food was bomb!! Definitely a place to eat!  Highly recommend.
Nice view of Hudson River while you dine , very relax atmosphere, good to grab a drink after visiting Statue of Liberty/ Wall Street
My entire team had a great time and loved the location and set up outside was perfect!

My post birthday dinner with husband. It is a beautiful location. My husband enjoyed his steak just wish there was vegetables to go along the baked potato. My salmon was salty and the asparagus overcooked. They did not have the frozen margaritas like they advertised on the menu. They did classic margarita on the rocks for me but when I receive it, it was served in the water glass! That is a no-no. It was packed with ice. I do not have any plans on going back to this business.

Server was oversat but still felt like he had time to run drinks or take orders from every table in the section but mine. Food didn’t come out together and I had to ask a busser twice and wait 30 mins for the check. Once the manager finally brought me the check, the server came to grab the book immediately, after not even bothering with my table for the previous 30 mins. Left feeling unseen, last time I came it was much better though? This could be an issue because I dine alone as I’ve had it happen at other places? Not sure, disappointed but optimistic that this place can and will do better

Also, plastic cups for condiments just feel out of place? This isn’t shake shack lol

Ambience fabulous 
Food greet

I went for a treat during my vacation and I was a solo diner. I was treated very well and I got a table on the patio which was beautiful. I chose the prix dice meal and it was very good. The buratta salad was the highlight. The crème brûlée was a bit overcooked, but it was a very nice experience and my server was truly outstanding!

I went to Industry Kitchen with a group of friends for restaurant week, where you are supposed to get a good deal to try new restaurants,  They have a restaurant week menu, but if you add each item individually, it’s not a deal. Dinner for restaurant week was $60 there and if you add each item off the menu, it comes up to $61. You only save one dollar. Not worth going during restaurant week.

Celebrated my husband's birthday (just the two of us) here on a Tuesday evening. The location is nice, has a lovely view of the water and doesn't feel like it's under a highway at all. Service is friendly, and the food is appetizing and good portions. We loved the truffle fries and drinks. He had the chicken & I had the salmon which we both enjoyed. It was busy when we were there (6:00ish) but didn't feel cramped. Would definitely come back!

We shared an artichoke pizza for the table of four as an appetizer which was delicious.  We shared the big steak and one of us wanted it more well done than the other three.  It came out perfect for each of us.  Looking forward to going again.
The seaport’s gem for a fabulous brunch! Incredible service and amazing food as always. Love everything about Industry Kitchen! Highly recommend this restaurant!!
Had brunch on a hot Sunday in July.  Fortunately, the shadows covered our table.  Food was excellent as was the service.
the food was just okay, our server hardly check on us which we needed some drinks and help with the food.
First time there.  Service and food were very good.  I would return and tell others to go there
Thank you our team had a great time, the staff was great as was the food.
We had a great time, as always, and Brooke was a fabulous server. She took care of us in the best way.

On a 95 degree day, they had the doors open to the outside, so even though I asked to be seated inside, we were SO hot. It was impossible to enjoy the meal or my company. And the service was poor. Our server disappeared and it took way too long to order. The staff was so hot and uncomfortable. They should not have to work in those conditions. Crank up the air and keep the doors closed.

Dinner was good from a food standpoint but service was spotty at best; no drink order when we sat down, ultimately arrive after food was served.  We were on far corner of patio but not out of eyeshot.  Also, got served dessert we didn’t order, but they comped that and brought the right one overall OK but nothing to write home about

A great summer evening overlooking the water!

I would keep it simple with the fools
Pizza/Salad, etc

Small Martini and Small Glass of Wine

It was good. Servers need to know how to serve. Passing food across to someone on the other side of the table means you're clothing will go in the glass.  One server dropped the empty glass on the table.  The other brought a dirty glass.  Food  was good. Why is the waffle so flat?  Waffles are thick and filling.
I really enjoyed my time dining here! It was great

Met with friends. Ambience and location was perfect. Service by Andrew was great. He was attentive and responded to requests quickly. Food was ok but the cocktails were great. Loved everything about our visit to Industrial kitchen.
Great food. Outdoor dining overlooking the East River. Staff is fantastic. Drinks and food are delicious!

The food came out incredibly quickly which I really appreciated for a mid-week lunch. The food is pricy, but I definitely recommend the salads. Our waitress was very friendly (almost too friendly!!) The view is beautiful!
Good place for drinks at sunset. Food was nothing exciting.
Amazing setting, casual dining with a very diverse menu. The food was enjoyed by the whole party. Great spot for a drink, brunch, lunch or dinner.
Delicious food.  Best menu of any restaurant in the area.
Much better options in the area if visiting the south street seaport area.
Service was slow and the food was average. The saving grace was the muscles appetizer. Huge portion and the best thing we ordered.

We had a reservation but arrived an hour early. We were received graciously and seated immediately. We tried many appetizers and a range of items from the menu. Not the easiest customers but we were very happy and the staff took very good care of us.
Excellent food, great view, and the staff is friendly and efficient.  I would recommend this for anyone.

My sister and I had a great meal. The music gave the restaurant a chill vibe! Andrew was a dream, he took care of multiple tables and was always upbeat and caring. I would give our brunch a score of 15 if I could. We will definitely be back!

After a day spent touring the Statue of Liberty this was a short and pleasant walk from the Battery. The view and ambiance was wonderful. The food delicious. The service was very professional as well. I highly recommend.
Very good food and service.
We made a reservation for 5 , but they only had a table for 4. Lots of open space but we were not allowed to move . Good was fine at best. Meh- wouldn’t go back
Service was really bad as we waited well over an hour for any of our food
Don’t go for the food. Ahi tuna nachos were in edible.

Unfortunately had three large drinks spilled all over us. Manager did offer to take care of dry cleaning bill. We saw the same server spill drinks all over another table after ours. Food was great though, so it definitely helped make up for a not so great start to our work lunch.
Great food. Incredible and friendly service.  Would recommend to anyone!
Always have a great time. Food delicious!
Absolutely lovely setting and delicious food! Thank you!

What a river view. Cannot beat a more idyllic setting. The staff is super friendly and the menu has something for everyone. I would highly recommend reserving a table as it is unsurprisingly full even during lunchtime on a regular weekday. Once you eat there - you will understand why. Enjoy yourselves.

In my 50 years of dining in NYC restaurants, I have never had a kinder and more thoughtful waiter.  My two girlfriends and I ate out on the patio, and then talked and laughed for 4 hours. Without even ordering  coffee or dessert.  Our adorable waiter did not rush us out, kept bringing us fresh water and even moved our umbrella so the setting sun would not get in our eyes.   The food was good and plentiful (although, I do wish there was a turkey burger on the menu!) we were comfortable and the setting just lovely.  But I will NEVER forget the kindness of your staff and that waiter.  Of course, we gave him a tip that was twice the cost of our meal.  Well deserved  !!! Doesn't happen all that much!!

Warmly, Barbara Rosenberg
Stale pita. Annoying camera guy comes around to take your photo and makes you get up for all different poses. Awkward and Unnecessary. Is this Disneyland?

Nothing memorable - some dishes were good (lobster taco, pizzas), others not so good (chicken, salmon - mix of flavors that don't belong together). Wine arrived after finishing our entree. No water for a long time. Would not come back.

Food was just okay, all entrees for 6 people came out within literally less than 10 minutes from ordering when the restaurant was packed, so I don’t think most things are necessarily made to order, but the vibe is great!
Food was delicious and you cannot beat the location and view!
Our server, Veronica, was EXCELLENT!! The food very tasty and drinks were spot on.

I made a reservation for 6 and arrived on time but shockingly my reservation was ignored. Our only choice was outside in a light drizzle or inside at a wobbly high top table/booth. 

The waitress then accidentally spilled beer and ginger ale on one person in our party. The food was good but overall it was not the best impression made for a business lunch.
The food was tasty and the portions were larger than I expected them to be! Not 5⭐️ because it wasn’t the tastiest food I’ve ever had, but still really good!
Poor & unfriendly service

I usually like this place, it’s my go to place when friends are in town, good food and nice location.  Last night was a bit of disappointment, even if I had a reservation I was ignored for a good 20 minutes, and the place seemed overbooked and very chaotic. I will go back, but probably not soon

Unfortunately with the increase in the number of covers, this once great restaurant has gone down greatly in quality. 

First we were told the drinks we wanted they didn’t have. Then we’re further told half the beer menu was out of stock. 

Then entrees took over an hour and a half to arrive. ‘Kitchen had put through the wrong order’. We were offered a free round of drinks as an apology but what good is that when half your drinks are out of stock.
This is a go to restaurant for me when I’m in the city. Both for client dinners or when I’m solo. Great drinks, great food and just a fun atmosphere.

Four diners had different experiences with the food. Pizza and lobster tacos were the best. Crab cakes were just okay—too much filling not enough crab. Ahi tuna gets a F. The tuna was not fresh and not really edible.
Took forever to get silverware- a manager had to get us some. Then we ran late for theater because server just never was around. Server was friendly but not efficient
Sat outside on a beautiful day - feels like you are out of the city
It’s my 3rd visit and it hasn’t failed me a bit! The friends I took, is just as impressed. Keep up the good work!
Food was pretty good. Our server was super nice and helpful. The view was great on the patio. Food is a little pricey but that’s New York.
one of the best indoor/outdoor dining, incredible views of Brooklyn Bridge and Seaport
Great outdoor vibes. Got a few different pizzas that were all great. The burrata was so delicious! Cocktails were tasty. Overall a great experience, but a bit pricy for what it is.

Pizza was good. I liked the location and the playlist (Seemed Tame Impala based) Music could be one notch down.  Server did a great job but could use more help - challenge of the time. Good bussing. Lobster was a bit stringy and steak was not worth the price. Prices were reasonable in general. I would recommend for groups. Good cocktails and beer selection.
Great ambiance, always very busy, service is kind of lacking, but great vibe and good food. Recommended!
Great view and excellent service
Lots of fun and good food
Super fun night, great ambiance. Perfect for a nice meal out with great views of the water.

Had a very nice lunch looking out over the East River.  Great for people watching too.   Food was really good (Summer Squash pizza and Cesar salad).  We had a reservation and were seated right away, but there was a line to get in for those without reservations.
Always an absolute delight at IK! I will continue to frequent this place.
Great ambiance, great location, great service, great food and drinks. Only negative is all the “glassware” is plastic
Fantastic venue for outdoor dining!
We received outstanding service & attention from the staff for a special lunch on a busy day at their beautiful outdoor patio!  Reasonable prices for such a beautiful location on the water.
Everything was great just the blueberry crumble was horrible. Sorry 🤷🏻‍♀️

The food was delish.  We had a variety of different things and everything was wonderful.  The Barata, avocado toast, Caesar salad, smoked bacon pizza, tomahawk ribeye, and strawberry shortcake.  Everything was great!
Wonderful evening to dine outdoor. The food and service were great. Will visit again.

Very nice place for lunch.. good food, interesting menu, mostly good service, nice setting.. a little too noisy for my preferences, and my request for a shady table was only partially met, but I’d definitely go back again and recommend it
This feels like fancy airport food, it’s fine but overpriced and not memorable, but nice view, decent service.  Nothing exciting,
We sat outside on a perfect day and the view was beautiful overlooking the water. The staff was courteous and attentive. The food was delicious!
Why blast club music on a beautiful Sunday during brunch time?  Ruined the otherwise relaxing and picturesque environment.
Nice spot for outdoor dining and people watching but for what we paid I hoped the food would be better.

Great service 
Outstanding food.
Very accommodating.
The restaurant was out of too many menu items.  The Parmesan fries were dry and inconsistent.  I did like the server and ambiance but probably will not go back
Ambiance, service, and cocktails were great! Tuna nachos weren’t what I expected and wouldn’t recommend.
Incredible food and service, and great location by the river. We had a blast!
The food was below average. Small burrata and tasteless tomatoes. No salt or olive oil. Fries were cold, and we had to wait and ask 4 times for sauce. Service was either slow or inexistant.
Quality food has changed since last year. Low food quality, the pizzas are not the same.
Everything was great from waiter service to food/drinks.
So pretty!
Great waterfront restaurant!
Sehr gutes Restaurant mit einem sehr schönen Ambiente. Sehr freundlicher und aufmerksamer Service. Sehr zu empfehlen

It was a busy Friday night, so the service was decent for the number of full tables. The food was hit or miss, some dishes were excellent and some were overpriced for small portions. The noise level was so high it was uncomfortable and nearly impossible to hear the person beside you without yelling. I've wanted to try this place for awhile and overall was disappointed with the experience.
Loved this place!
The food and view was great. Great service and staff.

It wasn’t that clean. The pizza wasn’t good, friendly staff but not amazing. Pretty pricy considering everything. And the noise level was bad because of bad acoustics. 
The view was fine. 
But I wouldn’t recommend the place. 
Sorry :-(
It was very nice
Kitchen could only serve cold platters since they had issues with the oven. Made the best of it, Service was good and it's a nice location.  I would give it another try.

Food was ok.  Service extremely slow.  Worst was they did not honor a reservation.  Told me it would be a long wait - despite my reservation - unless I agreed to sit outside, when I specifically made reservation for indoors.

I had been wanting to try Industry Kitchen for some time, mostly due to its wonderful waterfront location. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the food is just as terrific as the view. My sundried tomato hummus, kale salad with shrimp and blueberry crumble were all fantastic. My server Sam was an absolute star! He was so friendly and accommodating, and made certain that my dining experience was perfect. All of the other staff members- including the hostesses and the busboys - were just as amazing. I can't wait to go back!

Great outdoors venue right next to south street Seaport. Situated on the greenway pier the views and open air in s refreshing. You don’t really notice the overhanging highway so that wasn’t really a problem. The food was great - all comfort food - and the drinks were enjoyed by all. Picnic tables available for large parties. Everyone enjoyed.
Dinner with work colleagues. Food was terrific! Definitely recommend.
Industry Kitchen is my go-to for a drink and a bite, with friends or solo. The staff is wonderful. Especially love the bar - Matt, OJ, Pre - awesome staff!

We arrived an hour early for our reservation and were able to be seated anyway. We were told that we could only have the table for 1.5 hours, which was totally fine. Our waiter took our order promptly and food delivered quickly, then he disappeared. Asked for dressing on the side of the Caesar salad and it came dressed. Also ordered Bianca pizza, which was delicious. After almost 2 hours we had to ask for our check, which was ok for us because we were enjoying our white sangria and chatting. Overall a good experience and we would return.
50th birthday
Very busy I think there is not enough staff; our apps AND main dishes  came out before our cocktails came out which was bizarre and kinda ruined the vibe.
Food was good,although portions were inconsistent. Waiter was slow and hard to get ahold of

Pleasantly surprised! Usually places with a view don't have great food. We enjoyed our dinner here, lobster ravioli was really good. Dessert was excellent (didn't have apps). Beer was good as expected (good little selection). Waiter did a nice job. Would not hesitate to return.

Been here quite a few times, but this time it was just not the normal for it.  Service was slow and generally poor, I don’t feel I should have to flag the waiter down every time.  Took 20 minutes to get water.  Oh well.  Food was ok, not as good as usual.  Guess it was an off day for industry Kitchen, I hope

We live in the neighborhood and have been to the restaurant a number of times and we know the service is never good but yesterday was the worst experience yet. We were told nothing was available for us while it was raining and the restaurant was empty. Went on open table and casually got a table. Then took forever for a server to come to the table that clearly didn’t want any tables. We were ready to spend money and hang out for the afternoon but service made us leave. The server didn’t know anything about the menu sent us the wrong food but we just didn’t say anything because it took forever. Any time we wanted another round of drinks it was a problem. I would turn to the host staff to look for help and they would stare at me knowing I needed help and wouldn’t come over. Easily the worst experience I’ve had at any restaurant in Fidi since I’ve lived here.
Brunch with an awesome view on the East River was the perfect setting for the start of our Mother-Daughter Weekend! Our waiter made it fun, also!

Nice place if you eat outside, with a beautiful view of the river and Brooklyn (inside is very noisy). Small plates are creative and good, but the best part of the menu is the pizza, with really superior crust, and a number of good choices including vegetarian. Will go again.
Great experience and food!
Food was good with generous portions. The mouse is amazing! Sit outside if you can.
So great! So many gluten free options and a great atmosphere on the water! A GREST lunch spot !

Hands down the best cocktails around!  Unique refreshing and top notch!
Outside seating was beautiful on the water and very quiet even though the place was packed!
Great views, food was really good. Small portions.
Always love the fabulous food and incredible service at Industry Kitchen!  Wish there were 10 stars for the review! xo
Food was ok.  Service was ok.  Crowd was annoyingly loud.  Seems like mostly tourist crowd.

Food overall was pretty good. Dessert was nothing too special. Noisy and hard to hold a conversation without shouting, but it was a good, high energy atmosphere. Service was a bit spotty, but suspect that it was short-staffed, esp. for the number of patrons. Gluten-free items on the menu were marked.
Way to load. Music level of a night club had everyone shouting at each other.
Excellent discovery in lower Manhattan. Food was both delicious and creative

It’s a great place and I’m a repeat customer but I have to say that the pizza margharita (sp? ) was just ok. My friend liked her summer squash pizza better. 
We had an early dinner starting at 4:39 and the music was turned up so loud we could barely hear each other talk. And we were seated outside near the walking path.

I come here regularly. The service last night was slower than usual bc there were a couple of large parties but the waitstaff was really accommodating about it and apologetic, in a way that made me love the place even more!  This is a regular standby place for me. The food, service, ambience, and water views regularly make it a pleasure to eat here. The food is consistently excellent and fresh.
Love Industry Kitchen. A must try are the Tuna Nachos and the Water View coctail
Delicious alfresco meal with friends. PERFECT outdoor location 🌞🌞🌞
Fabulous location in south street waterfront. Food and service were outstanding. My friends really enjoyed the lamb lollipops and I favored the lobster tacos. I will keep going back!

Our waiter Andrew was outstanding. We had a party of 11 and he didn’t skip a beat. Got every single order correct and was on top of us the whole time. Would hire this guy in a heartbeat if I had my own restaurant.

The outdoor dining in the summer is perfect, can’t beat the view and the whole vibe they have going on here.

The pizza was very good as were the Ahi Nachos. We also had some incredible meatballs and pizza. We didn’t like the steamed mussels them seemed very off and when I mentioned this to the staff they took them back no problem. 

Highly recommend this place for a get together with friends. Perfect for large parties and a great place to kick back and hang while enjoying the view.

What a great spot for an outdoor lunch: next to the river, right by the Seaport. We had to wait a bit for our table, even with reservation, but our server was enthusiastic and helpful. Tuna nachos were outstanding!  Salad was a generous portion, and 'Big Breakfast' was as advertised.  Would definitely visit Industry Kitchen again.

Food was delicious, but came out almost too fast. We were bombarded with appetizers before our drinks even came out. Felt rushed to eat as fast as possible to simply make room on the table. Will come back, but hopefully they slow down the service so you can actually enjoy and savor the food.

The industry kitchen has become my go to place for brunches and dinners with friends and colleagues.  The food is great and not expensive, the service good, but what I really like is the outdoor space that they went to great lengths to keep during the cold months.  Love the yurts!!!

Our reservation was for indoor but when we arrived only outdoor was available. Really disappointing, and the service following was slow. Pizza was great but would avoid the risotto, sounds great on the menu but was essentially goop (zero texture). Great location but for the money there are a ton of better places for eating.
Reservations on Open Table did not allow you to reserve a table inside. Inside is first come first serve. That should have been indicated on description

The restaurant has a fantastic location and very attentive service. The appetizers  and main dishes were delicious, and were good to share. Skip the desserts: Creme brûlée and strawberry shortcake were disappointing. Flavorless and drowned in whipped cream from a can. The shortcake was a salty hard biscuit. While the restaurant’s ambiance was beautiful, the noise level was very high. It was hard to have a conversation without raising your voice. This may be better when you sit outside. Would eat there again, especially with out of town guests.
Delicious food, great drinks and great service. You can see the river from all parts of the restaurant which is beautiful.
I  have been here many times pre-Covid and just now decided to go back.  I was with a friend and we found the salad very good and the pizza super good.  Will go back.
We were a table of 10 with four kids. They hosts were so wonderful. The servers were patient and kind, and the food was delicious. Perfect meal—thank you!

The location and the staff at industry Kitchen are excellent. We were greeted and seated at the table of our choice . Our server was pleasant and quick to approach us. We ordered the octopus starter. It was excellent . We ordered the scallops which were well executed but too sweet. Perhaps pizza would have been a better choice. The kale Brussel sprouts salad was delicious. The view and location are unmatched near the seaport. I would recommend it for outdoor lunch without hesitating…
The loudest place I’ve ever been
Very good place to eat, amazing view, tasty & generous food!

Unfortunately though we had a reservation for our party, the hostess couldn’t sit us at the table for 20-30 minutes. Only when manager was involved, we were finally able to get a table. Manager was very nice and truly apologetic
The food and dessert were great along with the ambiance.  Service was not great but overall a good experience and will go back

Ordered a bottle of wine off the menu for $58. Waiter brought a different bottle which sells retail for $9. Was still billed $58. Complained to manager, brought it down to $44. Still a complete rip off.

Perfect weather for outside dining. Despite being amazingly busy the service was wonderful. Great recommendations - all dishes were delish. 
Definitely hope for more beautiful weather so we can return.
Fantastic food with a beautiful view of Brooklyn
Had dinner with the family. The good was very good and excellent service. A bit of a limited menu both food and drinks but not too bad. Crowd tend to be on the young.side which is a bit refreshing.
Great place for a big group celebration!!!

lovely place near the water. Friendly and fast service, lots of light, great outside space for when it is warm, nice food. Just a bit too loud to have a lunch conversation easily. A bit much for the kids.

After bringing our food, the waiter completely ignored us.  I had to ask the Manager for the bill - and even when he saw that, he didn’t apologize.  He was the worst waiter I’ve ever had there.  Usually the service is great.

Ish our server was fantastic. We had the lobster omelet which was over cooked, meatballs, and the Margherita pizza which was okay. The food was not the best aspect but the service from all staff was phenomenal and would bring me back. From the greeter to the bussers and bartender and our girl Ish. Views are great would come back to try other items in the menu.
Great ambience , wonderful staff and great tasting food and views. I came here to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. We had a great time .

Checked Open Table nalf an hour before coming, there were tables available every 15 min.  Came there, girl in front said there's nothing available! Stepped aside, checked OT again, tables every 15 minutes. Made reservation, came back. Was seated by the same girl. What was that ?! Food and drinks overpriced for the quality.  Not bad but really average. No views from inside - all blocked by the " COVID bubbles". Not likely to come back mostly due to the host attitude.

The staff was so kind the food was delicious! Everything we had was so flavorful and good portions drinks were delicious! Our waiter in particular was such a delight the biggest smile and he really went above and beyond to make my husbands birthday fun! Definitely recommend for a cute date night or even just to go have a nice dinner! Just wear warm clothes if you’re sitting outside haha!
Everything about this place is perfect! Such a cute and warm outdoor patio, privacy was very nice in the igloos and my dog had a great time. The food was also incredible and service as well!
Service was too quick.
We got two pizzas: margherita and artichoke, both great and large portions. Other two had the octopus and the lamb lollipops, the latter were amazing! The service is superb.
Great food, super fast and the quality did not suffer.  Only downside was the music was just a little too loud. Highly recommend because of the food.
Great spot. Good food. Great host. Good drinks. Awesome.
This place is amazing
Fantastic service! Food was excellent as was the wine.  Had a great evening!
Service was not great, no special attention was given to group dining for which we prepaid a minimum amount
Excellent service.

It was honestly more than we expected. We were welcomed in ways that I've rarely been welcomed in a. restaurant. The food suggestions by the waiter were EVERYTHING. We were in the outside "tents" and worried that. it would be cold but. it was perfect. The only thing I would recommend is to not. take pizzas, not that they're not good but they do not reach the level that.  other plates there do. 
9/10 and thanks again to the receptionist and waiter that welcomed us in french with open arms and kindness.
Great food, something for everyone! Had the Vegan Gluten-free margarita pizza and ended up eating the entire thing. Will be coming again.
It’s fine but there are better restaurants

It was great time! The guy who helped us deserves a raise or hugs appreciation he was very kind and checked on us a lot. It was my
Baby brothers birthday and he definitely made it super memorable so I will definitely be coming back for sure! I forgot his name but I was at table 14 outside in the igloo tent so please let him know he did a great job!
This is a great place to go for a drink and app when the weather turns nice. Not a satisfying place for dinner, however. Go for a drinks and the view.
My grandmother loved her birthday dinner the phone was amazing especially the oysters oh my god to die for mostly I loved the salad the industry and the staff there are all amazing people
Great service and ambiance. Excellent food.
Great views, great food, great ambience, and loved the surprise picture. Service however was a bit too frequent, I’ll just press the buzzer when I’m ready.
Outdoor igloos were beautiful (they did get a little hot since it was 12pm and sunny), food was incredible, service was so fast, overall great experience.

Dined in the outdoor glasshouse with friends visiting from out of state. Appetizer meatballs and burrata were great, as were the cocktails! My gnocchi was a little on the sweet side; my friends enjoyed their mussels and chicken entrees. All in all, it was a great night and a pretty location on the water!
Waiter Danny (i think that was his name) was wonderful!
Everything was great. The food and service, I had no complaints.  The little glass houses are so cute.
My son and I loved this place for brunch.  The view of the East River and Brooklyn Bridge was special.  The food was delicious and the service was wonderful.
Great experience
Great food and service out on the patio in one of the greenhouses. Great place to enjoy the views by the water and people watch.

The brunch at Industry Kitchen was very pleasant.  The food was good.  The individual igloo was clean, comfortable, and warm enough, even without the heater on.  The waiter was pleasant and efficient.  The downgraded overall score comes from the disappointment that a birthday was indicated as the occasion for the visit.  However, there was no mention of this by the hostess or waiter and no attention to the occasion with a candle, dessert, etc.  If you ask if there is a special occasion for the reservation, then it should be recognized.  If you can't be bothered to look or notice, then why ask?!
It was a really nice experience. Being able to eat outside by the water was really a unique idea and the little personal eating boxes were so well lit as well as warm.
In the glass tent with heater. Nice setting.  Music too loud.  We were right below the outdoor speakers. Waiter was charming and helpful. Saturday 2/19.
Food was amazing. Service and ambience were on par too.
Amazing views of the water, great food and excellent service in a quiet, intimate atmosphere. Could not recommend more highly!
Daniel was an excellent waiter. He was friendly & attentive.
Waitress was super nice!!!!!
appetizers were delicious, but entree was not very good. poor service.
Went here for Valentine's dinner. Although we had a reservation, it felt that we were being rushed through our dinner. Apart from that, our host looked after us well and food was good too.
It was absolutely amazing and the steak was to die for! The little green glass houses were so amazing and cute!
The food was D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!! Our server, David, was very attentive, kind and gave an outstanding service.
It was perfect. We went for Fashion week and enjoyed the last day with snow fall and eating brunch at this fantastic place love the food and energy
It was amazing and Gaveric and his coworkers were amazing, very attentive, and down to earth! This place is awesome and the atmosphere is calm and nice!

It was loud, noisy and upon arrival we were shoved into a corner. Despite what had been published across multiple websites, we were informed that the Restaurant Week menu was no longer valid. The food was derivative and overpriced. My husband’s chicken had mushroom in the singular despite what was listed on the menu and I’ve had better seafood pasta from Perkins. When we were asked if we’d be interested in seeing a dessert menu, we responded in the affirmative despite our better judgment. We were presented instead with our check. Perhaps the best recommendation all evening.

The view is beautiful. I had one of
Those little cute houses, perfect for a couple of 4. Service was on point and food tasted amazing. Definitely goin back.
The foods  and dessert taste amazing. The indoor space is cozy and staff are friendly

Hello.  I ordered an expensive pancakes dish, and actually it tasted NOT fresh.  Maybe from the day before or a few good hours before I made my order.
I'm not looking for a refund, but the option to try the dish again.
Outstanding All around service and Food & Drinks. Great Vibe! Covid protocol in place. Winter Village outdoor private eating is genius! And heated! Location is beautiful....Serious Gem in NY!!!!
The greenhouses at Industry Kitchen are perfect for a date night! The food was amazing, so happy I found them through restaurant week.  Get the lamb chops!

Went for my boyfriend birthday and it was so nice. The food is great and drinks are definitely awesome as well. I will definitely come back. 

Oh and our waiter was so sweet !! He was so on point with service I didn’t even have to ask for more water he was awsome. Love it
Excellent food!
Fabulous food, service and views!  Will definitely be going back again and again!
Quality and consistent food.  Good drinks.  Excellent service.  Good for both personal and business dinners.
The food was soo good.  The staff was so nice and friendly.  We have no complaints whatsoever.  Everything was perfect.   We will be returning!!
Great setup for outdoor dining
The food has definitely taken a downturn from the summer. Our server was amazing but the food was subpar and the price was not worth it.

Really great setup - especially if you're still hesitant to do indoor dining in these times. Our waiter was amazing - he was super attentive. We also loved that there is a restaurant photographer that provides a free photo postcard and then you can purchase framed photos for $15.

You will not be cold, inside your little cabin, you have a heater and blankets are available to rent.
The bartender Matt was great. Very good service and just a really nice place.

We had the honeybee and the smoked bacon pizzas. The honeybee was really amazing and we ate the entire thing! The smoked bacon was awesome as well it was interesting and tasted like a loaded baked potato!  Definitely will come back!
Great food and service! The private dining cabin provided the perfect ambiance, and we really enjoyed the whole experience! Also the free photo postcards were wonderful!
loved it, can't wait to go back!  staff was amazing, and the glasshouse was so cool

Sitting inside a glass chalet in the snow, we felt warm and comfy, and very safe from COVID-19.  And, the food was superb.  Especially we loved Grilled Pinwheel Sausage! 
Plus, very friendly service.
This restaurant far exceeded our expectations!  Everything we had was excellent!  We are in the neighborhood and anxious to return for another visit
everything was great from the food, service, music, and the outdoor greenhouses!

My husband and I had a really nice date night here.  Excellent ambience, private space felt comfortable and heaters kept us warm. Food was very yummy.  I got the gnocchi, it was a bit sweeter than I expected, but still tasted good. Husband got the chicken which was quite good, I tried it.  Nice portions, felt sated but not so much not to want dessert. Creme brulee hit the spot.

We had the worst service. We arrived and didn’t have a waiter come over for 20 minutes and there was no one around for us to ask. Then we received all of our food before our drinks which were not good. The atmosphere is pretty, but I would not go back.

I took my wife, daughter and husband to dinner for my wife's birthday. Couldn't have had a better time. We sat in one of the glass houses and it was wonderful. Service was excellent, food was perfect and tasty and a great time. I highly recommend.
Service very friendly, food wonderful, and ambience was fun with great music but not too loud to prevent conversation. Overall a great date-night dining experience!

A beautiful glass box on the water, varied menu (we had the prosciutto board, tuna nachos and chicken on greek salad, all of which were terrific), our waiter Andrew was excellent and very nice, and we will be back again soon!
Loved the view 😍

Waiter came to us only 15 minutes after being seated.  waiter checked up on us one time throughout the entire meal. the specific waiter did not serve us our food, or water, only took order). food was ok.

Everything was perfect and so romantic! We even got our picture taken for free and a complimentary postcard with the photo on it! The view and heated enclosed house with lights was all amazing. The only thing was that the food got cold fast (because it was cold out) so maybe having the food covered until it is served would be better? Nonetheless, the food tasted great and the overall experience was wonderful. Especially during COVID and wanting to be outside without freezing. I’ll definitely be returning.

The setting at the Seaport area and the multiple indoor or outdoor seating options are much appreciated, as is the variety of the brunch menu.  The selections are well executed.

But the top attraction of this busy restaurant is the high level of service….friendly and efficient

We sat in an Outdoor Glasshouse, which on a very cold and windy day, it was delightful.  The only challenge was the door closure.  It was hard to close shut tightly, so every time it was opened, it was a bit of a struggle and loud!  Other than that, very delightful!
Was there on 1/8/22 an extremely cold day. Heaters could have been a little stronger.

The dining glasshouses outside are perfect for very cold nights!  Not too warm, not too cold, just right.  Great service, great food, good tunes at the right decibel level.  Highly recommend this place, which I've been to many times before but never in winter, for a wonderful dinner out with friends and family!
The igloos are great and warm. Service was wonderful
The lamb dish I had was very tasty and flavorful! Highly recommend. The cocktail I had was also pretty strong, which I didn’t mind.
Everything about my experience was amazing. The service was very nice, the food was amazing, and the location was beyond beautiful. Great prices for a high end experience!
Wonderful place and the service was fantastic. The views from this place were also very good.

Great food, and stunning views.The “greenhouses “ are heated and we kept the door open for air. Safe in these challenging times! Professional and warm staff that welcomes you back.
Happy New Year!
Food and service were great. We especially like the greenhouses for safe and comfortable outdoor eating. So glad they added more this year!

Great restaurant, very friendly staff, ambience and view are spectacular. I got the Pepperoni Wood Fired Pizza and the Atlantic Salmon. Both were excellent although the choice of cheese for the pizza can be improved.
Great view of the water and amazing food!
I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. From the service, to the view, the food and the greenhouse. I totally recommend it!
Food was excellent, staff was very friendly, and the lights and the view were amazing!
Beautiful place, nice service, good atmosphere.I highly recommend it

La cuisine était bonne, le cadre super, notre serveur Emon très gentil mais au moment de payer nous ne comprenions pas le ticket avec le principe des tip après paiement. Les 2 autres serveurs à côté de nous plutôt que de nous expliquer se moquaient de nous et de notre anglais. Ils rigolaient comme 2 abrutis de 15 ans !! Nous sommes partie sans laisser de pourboire puisque personne n’était assez gentil pour nous aider !
We went for a low key Christmas dinner. Beautiful location and good food.

Went here for Christmas brunch and it was wonderful! So festive and cozy and the waitstaff was wonderful. They have such a great selection of food here.
