We ended up getting a bunch for the table and splitting everything. They also had some festive drinks that made the day special. There was also a photographer there for Christmas taking pictures and giving out free post cards. The view of the water is unparalleled. Highly recommend!
Eat herè...its fantastic. Definately try the Fondue.
Great food. Great service. Will definitely be back!!
Would return for a meal anytime that I am in the city.
It is beautiful sitting outside in the little glass greenhouses and looking out over the East River toward Brooklyn, NY!
Glass houses are awesome, warm, and quite.  Fondue for two was excellent - but they charged me for extra bread I asked for but didn't tell me it was extra.  I would go again if I am in the area.
The dinner was delicious, IK Seafood Bowl does not disappoint!
Great view good drinks I would definitely go back
Grilled lamb lollipops was so good and the mussels was very good.
A wonderful igloo experience.  Emily was such a nice server.  The support staff were also very good.  The food was delicious.  We look forward to coming back.
Love this place! Always visit when In nyc
Booked an outdoor chalet for dinner, they are equipped with a space heater and it was very comfortable.  Food is mediocre but the ambiance was great.
Great views, service and location

Very unique private  “cabin” on the rooftop.  Loved the Yule log on the TV screen! Food was very good and fast, but the “to go” containers didn’t do it justice. Great service and the call bell is a great idea. Beautiful spots to get photos on the roof. Only improvement I could suggest would be a nicer way to serve the very tasty food. Would definitely go back again.

The outdoors sitting option is nice, especially if dining with kids.
Food menu is interesting - but beverage menu could do with a little more work, particularly the wine list.
Food was B+. Soup and pizza were very good. Steak not so much.
Waitress was very kind, but maybe a little slow and not checking on us often enough. 
Overall a nice experience.
Excellent food
Never again.  Wine in a plastic tumbler?  Yuck
Great pizza, great views and exceptional service!!
Really lovely food, great service, music a little loud though. Ate outside in a greenhouse
The outdoors is too cold & compact. Moved inside even indoors it was cold.
Lovely outdoor seating booth, great service, great waiter, food was excellent and reliable as always.

The noise was terrible!
To sit outside would may be an great experience, but inside it was terrible.

The crab cake was good!
The outdoors hut are nice but cold, so wrap up warm!
Wonderful service,made us feel very welcomed,very romantic and private in the heated green house great view

Dined here for Thanksgiving 2021 and sat in one of the lovely glasshouses facing the East River. Every course was delicious, the atmosphere was incredible and the service was perfect. Definitely recommend it!

Honestly, it was a bad experience but I was going to ignore it but I received my credit card bill today and they tacked on $ to the bill (was it to the tip? Who knows?)  so I’m writing a review a few days later. The server told me the pizzas were personal size so we over ordered, we weren’t super hungry and one pizza could have fed three. We sat in a greenhouse and watched the numerous rats on the esplanade. The server never checked in after our food was delivered and he was slow to bring our check and final bill. The pork belly pizza was horrible tasting. Truly a negative experience overall. And bummer they over charged us.
Great outdoor seating in glasshouses. Hey cute and enjoyable. Food was better than expected too.
Siblings day together really
Food was not good No flavor  just no
Très bonne table avec des serveurs au petit soin. Très bonne ambiance. Les plats sont servis très rapidement.
Great food! The outdoor greenhouses are beautiful and warm!
Loved the little “houses” outside!  Our server Omar was great!!!
Fabulous meal, wine and service
Absolutely love the outdoor individual seating with heater and lighting
Waitress was so nice and efficient. The food was great we loved the touch of fig jam on the lamb lollipops and the chocolate mousse dessert!
Exceeds expectations every time. Love everything about Industry Kitchen! Fave spot in seaport for brunch. 😎

we went for lunch and were not disappointed ,  I had the pinwheel sausage, it was very good the spinach and potatoes were awesome, the meatballs were one of the best i have ever had.  we would go back in a heartbeat
Great configuration for outside dining in FiDi as lunch spot, right on the water as the weather remains relatively warm in the Fall.
great service. food came out quick and was delicious

Pizza made with high quality ingredients. Best gluten-free crust I have had. My husband who is not a gf eater thought it was indistinguishable from the real thing. Very enjoyable food.

Need more servers during the busy times but servers still served us with a smile even though very stretched.

Music was a little loud (in seating area outside just in front of the bar) but we managed it.

Great service- beautiful location- amazing view of Brooklyn skyline across the East River- ahi tuna nachos and cheese board with honey were favorite apps. Lots of outside tables to enjoy the view, just wish it had been warmer so we ate inside. Would recommend!
Lovely views and very attentive and friendly staff. Huge portions.
Everything was great. Loved the view and the food.

Everything  was good but the service had to wait 15 min until we had to flag down a waiter to serve us.Plenty of waitstaff to check on us but never did.One cocktail waitress stepped up at the end our dessert.

After having been at the 9/11 museum and at the top of 1 World Trade Center we were looking for a dinner spot.  We chose Industry Kitchen based on reviews and their menu and we were not disappointed!!   Everything was awesome.  Location, check.  Seevice, check.  Food, check…alright…excellent!  We had a cheese tray, the chicken and seafood pasta and it was all really really delicious.  Highly recommend this spot.
waiter was great!
Love the restaurant and location
We had a beautiful view and the place is also child friendly, a huge plus for us.
This was honestly nicer than I expected. It’s a pretty nice yet casual place to get a solid good bite with a nice view.

The waitress was not good.  The men that bring your food and bus the tables were excellent.  Waitress never brought the drinks so I asked the man who brought our food and he got them for us.  Waitress brought drinks while we were already eating n said she wanted to wait to bring drinks but forgot then saw we already had one.  Never came back again had to ask the hostess to find her so we could get our check!
Great dinner and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend
Enjoyed the evening thoroughly. Beautiful ambience, great food, great service.
Food was good, vibes are great! Service seemed a bit understaffed. Took about 20 mins for someone to take our drink order, but after that everything was prompt!

Truffle fries were not crispy at all and the ahi tuna nachos, while tasty were a bit hard to eat. Larger tuna pieces would have been a better execution. The ambiance outside is great and the service was pretty good.
Artichoke Pizza 10/10. That is all.
Very efficient and prompt service. Great waterfront location. Food is decent and good value. Starters/small plates are pricey and not as nice. Overall great Manhattan experience.
Waitress rushed us along; food was luke warm, bread was hard

Just had a lovely lunch with two out of town guests. It was lovely. 

There was a tiny service glitch at the beginning, and we had three servers introduce themselves as our server until we had one that stuck around. He was very good, so it wasn’t a massive big deal. We waited for nothing. 

Great food and ambience
The ahi tuna nachos were so yummy and a good size portion! Nice views of the Hudson, too!

Even when the restaurant business is suffering from a staff crunch, Industry Kitchen has an extraordinarily friendly and helpful team.  And that's just the beginning of a lovely meal that includes wood oven pizza, fresh salad, and inventive small plates all served in front of a fantastic view.  I love the pinwheel sausage and the hot honey pizza, but just about anything goes with that yummy frozen Aperol spritz.

As one of the few outdoor dining places for lunch in the financial district, Industry Kitchen is a favorite of my clients.  I've been here several times and the food, service, and atmosphere has always been great.
